content: Overview of managing leads and contacts in Mojo Managing and Editing Leads and Contacts Mojo's CRM system offers comprehensive lead management capabilities designed to keep your contacts organized and accessible: Centralized contact management: Each lead has a detailed contact card containing all relevant information Add multiple phone numbers, email addresses, and property details Access and update information quickly from one central location Key organizational features: Comprehensive contact cards with all lead details in one place Multiple communication channels for flexible outreach Group leads by custom categories for efficient management Assign leads to specific team members or departments Enhanced workflow tools: Create appointments and schedule tasks directly from contact cards Set follow-up reminders to ensure consistent communication Implement automated action plans for standardized follow-up processes Store property-specific information for real estate leads Contact card capabilities: Add billing and property addresses Track all interactions in one place Maintain detailed notes and conversation histories Monitor lead progress through your sales pipeline This intuitive system helps maintain an efficient workflow while providing the personalized service your leads expect. title: Mojo homepage and activity stream
description: Mastering the Activity Stream in Mojo Dialing System The Activity Stream gives you a comprehensive view of everything happening in your Mojo account. Think of it as your command center where you can track all completed tasks, upcoming activities, and ...
content: Mojo homepage and activity stream Mastering the Activity Stream in Mojo Dialing System The Activity Stream gives you a comprehensive view of everything happening in your Mojo account. Think of it as your command center where you can track all completed tasks, upcoming activities, and team performance all in one place. What You Can Track in the Activity Stream Complete visibility into your team's work View notes added to contact records Monitor scheduled and completed activities Track assigned tasks and their completion status See progress on action plans and checklist items Review sent communications and completed calls Keep tabs on record changes (edits and deletions) Flexible time filtering Quickly view the last seven days of activity Set custom date ranges for specific reporting periods Focus on today's activities for daily planning. Reporting capabilities Print activity logs for meetings or record-keeping Create physical documentation of completed work Generate offline summaries for review Using the Activity Stream Effectively Access your activity center Log in to your Mojo account Look for the Activity Stream section on your Home Screen Focus on what matters Use the date filters to narrow down your view Choose "Past 7 Days" for recent activity Select custom dates for specific reporting periods Review your team's progress Scan through the chronological list of all activities Identify completed tasks and outstanding items Monitor which team members are most active Take action on what you see Print summaries for team meetings or documentation Email specific activities to relevant team members Identify patterns to improve team efficiency By regularly checking your Activity Stream, you'll maintain better oversight of your team's performance and ensure no important follow-ups or activities fall through the cracks. title: Welcome to Mojo - Guide to Getting Started
description: Getting Started with Mojo: A Complete Guide for New Users Introduction Welcome to Mojo! This comprehensive guide will walk you through everything you need to know to start using your Mojo system efficiently. While Mojo offers numerous features and ...
content: Welcome to Mojo - Guide to Getting Started Getting Started with Mojo: A Complete Guide for New UsersIntroductionWelcome to Mojo! This comprehensive guide will walk you through everything you need to know to start using your Mojo system efficiently. While Mojo offers numerous features and options, this guide focuses on the basics to help you get up and running quickly. Let's explore the key components of your Mojo account and how to navigate them effectively.Homepage OverviewWhen you first log into Mojo, you'll see the homepage with several important sections:Top Navigation Bar: Features links to:Neighborhood SearchExpired LeadsFor Sale By OwnerDialing StatsNote: If you have subscriptions to these services, clicking will take you directly to them. If not, you'll be directed to a subscription page.Today's Activities: Displays your scheduled activities for the day, including:AppointmentsTasksFollow-up callsA "Go to Calendar" button for viewing your entire scheduleActivity Stream: Shows your activities from the past seven days, such as:Scheduled appointmentsFollow-up callsContact editsDeletionsCompleted dial sessionsFor team accounts, this displays everyone's activities for better coordinationTraining Webinars: Access live training sessions held twice daily (11:00 AM and 3:00 PM Eastern, Monday through Friday) with a live instructor and Q&A sessions.News Section: Keeps you updated on new features and important Mojo announcements.System Status: Indicates whether all systems are functioning normally or if there are any service interruptions.Internet Latency: This tracks your Internet Latency to check the stability of your Internet and Web Browser. When clicking on this link you can view your Connect History.Basic NavigationThe left sidebar provides access to Mojo's core features:1. Home: Returns you to the main dashboard.2. Data and Dialer: The control hub for managing your contacts and starting dial sessions:o View and organize all your contact datao Start dialing sessionso Import files3. Calendar: Access all your scheduled appointments, follow-up calls, and tasks.4. Reports: View detailed statistics about your calling activity:o Number of calls madeo Call recipientso Resultso Durationo Performance analytics5. Lead Store: Subscribe to or manage Mojo's data services:o Expired datao For sale by owner datao For rent by ownero Pre-foreclosureso Neighborhood searcho Skip tracing6. Settings: Contains essential configurations for making calls and using other system features7. Account: Provides access to Profile and login information, Owner access to CRM User information, Billing information and Subscriptions.8. Notification Bell: This is where you can view notifications such as scheduled calls and appointments.9. Prospecting Dashboard: Clicking this will take you to a different page that will allow you to set up prospecting goals that can be tracked.10. Logout: Clicking this allows you to logout of your Mojo account. Account SectionThe Account section (accessed via Account towards the top right of your Mojo.Profile: Available to all users to:Edit personal information (name, address)Update email addressChange passwordCreate an email signature for messages sent from MojoBilling (account owners only): Manage credit card information and review billing history.Agents (account owners only): Manage multiple agents:Edit login informationReset passwordsAssign/reassign user-specific subscriptionsEdit User Type (access level)Subscriptions (account owners only): Manage your Mojo subscriptions:Add or remove lead manager agentsAdd or remove dialing subscriptionsManage data and Mojo Voice subscriptionsAdjust payment schedules (monthly, quarterly, biannually, or annually)Refer a Friend: Earn account credits when you refer new customers:$25 credit for Single Line Dialer sign-ups$50 credit for Triple Line Dialer sign-upsSettings AreaThe Settings area (accessed via Top Bar Navigation)Caller ID: Required for making calls through Mojo:Add any phone number you own (cell phone, office phone)The number must be able to receive incoming calls for verificationTo add a caller ID, click the "Add Caller ID" buttonMojo Caller ID: Purchase a dedicated business number through Mojo:Legitimate phone numbers routed to your preferred lineRequires verification to ensure it's a real numberWhitelisting: A complimentary service that:Provides additional protection for your numberNotifies carriers that your number is legitimateAutomatically initiates appeals if your number is reported as spamCall Back Messages (Multi-Line Dialer only): Automated message that plays when more than one person answers simultaneously. Record via:Mobile phone (scan QR code)Web (computer microphone)Drop Voicemail: Optional messages you can leave on answering machines:Record via mobile phone or webSimilar process to call back messagesUser must click a button to initiate message playbackCalling Scripts: Create and store scripts to reference during calls:The "Create Calling Script" button allows you to create or add a script you already haveUse merge tags (e.g., "first name") to personalize automaticallyThe "Create with AI" button allows you to use AI to create your calling scriptinstruct the AI to create your calling scriptclick the 'play' button to get resultsuse AI Shortcuts to adjust as neededIntegrations: This is where you will find and/configure all of the current integrations we offer with third party programs and companies.Lead StoreThe Lead Store provides access to Mojo's data services:Available services (all à la carte):Expired dataNeighborhood searchFor sale by ownerFor rent by ownerSkip tracerPre-foreclosureOnly account owners can purchase subscriptions.Importing FilesIf you have your own spreadsheets to import:Navigate to Data and Dialer screen.Click the Blue Import File button on the bottom left.Follow the five-step import process:Step 1: Choose your file (XLS, XLSX, or CSV).Step 2: Select your import destination:Calling List: For non-qualified leads you need to callGroups: For already qualified leadsSource (optional): Additional identifier for data originManager (optional): Only needed for group imports with lower-access agentsStep 3: Map your fields:Match spreadsheet headers to Mojo fieldsSmart mapping automatically recognizes common fieldsUse dropdowns to manually match fields if neededRemove incorrect mappings with the red XCreate custom miscellaneous fields for additional dataSave your mapping as a template for future importsStep 4: Check for duplicates (optional):Check against entire database, within file, or bothSearch by phone number, email, property address, or mailing addressChoose how to handle duplicates:Keep Old (default): Retains existing recordsKeep New: Replaces existing records with new dataImport New and Old: Allows duplicates as separate recordsStep 5: Review and complete:Verify all settings are correctView duplicate records if foundReturn to previous steps if changes are neededClick Finish Import to complete the processAdding Individual ContactsTo add contacts manually:From the Data and Dialer screen, click Create Contact in the top right.Enter the person's information.Select which list to add them to.Click Create Contact.Continue adding additional information if needed.Data and Dialer NavigationThe Data and Dialer section is where you manage all your contacts:All Contacts: Shows everyone in your entire database.Properties: Displays automatically posted data with listing status:Expired listingsCanceled listingsFSBO listingsData from integrated third-party vendorsCalling Lists: Contains imported files of non-qualified leads.Groups: Contains qualified leads (hot leads, warm leads, etc.).Calling Profiles: Saved dial session settings, primarily for lower-access agents.Additional features:Create Contact: Manually add new contactsPrint: Generate mailing labels, letters, and hot sheetsManage Columns: Customize which data columns appearMass Actions: Perform actions on multiple selected contacts:Move to group or listAdd to DNC listAssign managerAssign action planExport dataDelete recordsSearch Contacts: Find contacts by name, address, keyword, or custom fieldsStarting a Power Dial SessionTo begin making calls:Select your list in the Data and Dialer section.Click Power Dialer to access the Call Wizard.Configure your dialing settings:Caller ID: Select which number to displayVoicemail (optional): Choose a message to leaveCall Back Message (required for multi-line dialing)Rings: Set how many rings before moving to next call (4-7)Lines: For Triple Line Dialer, choose 1-3 linesCall Hammer: Enable to try multiple numbers for the same contactVoicemail Call Hammer: Disable to stop trying numbers and move to the next contact after clicking "Voicemail" resultAdvanced Settings:Select lead sheet/calling scriptChoose script display optionsSet whether to skip scheduled callsConfigure linked contact handlingCalling Mode:Default: Call from where you last left off, prioritizing new leadsAlternative: Call from top to bottomAuto-Send Email: Configure automatic emails based on call resultsOptional Dialing Filters:Filter by attempt countSkip recently dialed numbersSkip recently contacted numbersSkip numbers that received voicemailsFilter by create date or status change dateSet date order (newest or oldest first)Filter by list priceClick Start Power Dialer to preview your list before calling.Review the preview and click Start Power Dialer again.Call the displayed phone number and enter the PIN to connect your phone.Keep your phone connected throughout your dialing session.Click Start to begin dialing.Managing Calls During a Dial SessionDuring your dial session, you'll see call result buttons to categorize each call:Contact: You reached the person you were looking for and qualified them.No Contact Next Number: You didn't reach the target person, try their next number.No Contact Next Record: Skip to a completely new contact.Bad Number: The number is incorrect.Voicemail: Leave a recorded message if set.DNC Contact/Number: Add to Do Not Call list.Remember to click one of these buttons at the end of each call to move to the next contact.ConclusionThis guide covers the essentials to get you started with Mojo. As you become more familiar with the system, you can explore advanced features and customizations to further enhance your experience. Remember that Mojo offers training webinars twice daily if you need additional assistance or have specific questions about any features.For best results, we recommend starting with a small calling session to get comfortable with the system before scaling up your calling activities. Keep your caller ID and voicemail messages updated, and take advantage of Mojo's organizational tools to manage your contacts efficiently. content: Creating and using import templates Creating and Saving Import Templates in Mojo Creating an Import Template Begin the import process by logging into Mojo and navigating to Data and Dialer Click the "Import File" button located at the bottom left of the screen Upload your data file in either CSV or Excel (XLS/XLSX) format Map your file columns to the corresponding Mojo fields: Match your spreadsheet columns to system fields like Name, Phone, Address, etc. Mojo will display your file's column headers to help with mapping Save your mapping as a template by clicking the Save Template button in the top left Name your template with a descriptive, unique name (examples: "FSBO Import" or "GeoFarm Template") Click Save to store your template for future use Using a Saved Template Start a new import by uploading your data file Select your saved template from the dropdown menu at the top left of the mapping screen Mojo will automatically apply all field mappings based on your saved template Review the mappings to ensure they match your current file structure Continue with the import process Using saved import templates significantly reduces setup time for recurring imports and helps maintain consistent data organization across your database. content: How to manually create contacts in Mojo Need to add just one or two contacts? Skip the full import process! You can easily create contacts manually in just a few steps. Adding a Contact Manually Go to Data and Dialer in Mojo Click the Create Contact icon in the top right corner Enter the essential contact information (name, address, phone, email) Choose which Calling List OR Group to add them to Optionally select a Source for tracking purposes Click Create Contact to save After creating the contact, the full Contact Record will open automatically, allowing you to add any additional details if needed. That's it! Your new contact is now ready for dialing. description: Importing Hyperlinks into Mojo Mojo allows you to import hyperlinks when uploading leads, giving you quick access to important webpages directly from your contact forms. Benefits Access relevant websites with a single click from contact records Open ...
content: Importing Hyperlinks with Your Contacts Importing Hyperlinks into MojoMojo allows you to import hyperlinks when uploading leads, giving you quick access to important webpages directly from your contact forms.Benefits Access relevant websites with a single click from contact records Open webpages in a new browser tab without leaving Mojo View and access hyperlinks directly from grid view without opening contact records How to Import Hyperlinks Prepare your import file Ensure all URLs include either http:// or https:// prefixes Example: https://www.example.com (not just www.example.com) During the import process If you haven't created a field yet: Click the "Add New Misc Field" button below the mapping area Create a new custom field with a Text format to store your hyperlinks Map your hyperlinked column to this new field If you already have a suitable field: Simply map your hyperlinked column to your existing field Accessing Your Hyperlinks From contact records: Find hyperlinks in the Misc Fields pane and click to open From data views: Add your hyperlink field as a column in your grid views to access links directly from your contact lists This setup creates additional efficiency by letting you access important websites while viewing contact lists without having to open individual contact records. title: How to import data into Mojo
description: How to Import Spreadsheets of Leads and Contacts into Mojo Dialer Introduction Importing your leads and contacts into the Mojo dialer is a straightforward process that allows you to efficiently organize and manage your customer data. This guide will ...
content: How to import data into Mojo How to Import Spreadsheets of Leads and Contacts into Mojo Dialer Introduction Importing your leads and contacts into the Mojo dialer is a straightforward process that allows you to efficiently organize and manage your customer data. This guide will walk you through the complete import process, from selecting your file to finalizing your import. Whether you're importing a new list or adding to an existing one, this step-by-step tutorial will help you get started quickly. Refer to the How-To videos on each step for guidance. Step 1: Choose Your File Click the Choose File button. Locate the spreadsheet file you want to import on your computer. Select the file and click Open. Mojo accepts XLS, XLSX, and CSV file formats. Once your file is selected, click Next to proceed to step two. Step 2: Select Import Destination In this step, you'll decide where to place your imported contacts: Choose whether to import into a Calling List or a Group: Calling Lists are general collections of leads to call or perform mass actions on that you have not yet spoken to. Groups are for leads with specific qualifications (hot leads, warm leads, future follow-ups, past clients, etc.) that you have spoken to. You can either: Create a new list/group by clicking the plus sign in the top right corner, then clicking Save. Add to an existing list/group by clicking on it in the displayed options. Optional settings: Manager selection (only needed if you have multiple agents with limited access). Source field to identify where your data came from (can select existing sources or create a new one). Click Next to continue to step three. Step 3: Map Your Fields This step connects your spreadsheet columns to the appropriate fields in Mojo: If you've imported similar spreadsheets before, you can select a saved Import Template from the dropdown on the left side. *They must have the same file field/header assignments. Mojo offers Smart Mapping, which automatically matches recognized fields from your spreadsheet. For manual mapping: Match each column from your spreadsheet to the corresponding Mojo field using the dropdowns. For example, map your spreadsheet's "Full Name" column to Mojo's "Full Name" field. If you have separate first and last name columns, map them individually to their respective fields. Address mapping: Map fields like Address, City, State, and Zip Code to their respective Mojo fields. If a field is incorrectly matched, click the X next to it to remove the mapping. Use the dropdown to select the correct field if needed.Refer to the Spreadsheet Reference at the bottom as needed. This shows the first few lines from your file so that you can identify the type of data in each column and refer to this when assigning your file fields. Phone number mapping: Mojo supports stacking fields for multiple phone numbers. Map each phone number field from your spreadsheet to the appropriate field in Mojo. Additional phone fields will appear automatically as you add them. Email mapping: Map the email field from your spreadsheet to the email field in Mojo. Miscellaneous information: For additional data beyond basic contact information, use the miscellaneous fields. Create custom fields by clicking the plus sign if needed. Select the appropriate field type (text, date, time, number, decimal, or percentage). Save your mapping as a template for future imports by clicking the save option. Click Next to proceed to step four. Step 4: Check for Duplicates This optional step helps you manage duplicate records: Choose where to check for duplicates: In the entire database (all lists and groups) Within the file you're importing Both options Select how to identify duplicates: By phone number (most common) By email By property address By mailing address Decide how to handle duplicates: Keep Old (default): Existing records are kept, and duplicates are not imported. Keep New: New records will replace existing records (note: this will delete any existing notes or call history). Import New and Old: Import duplicates, creating separate records (useful for having the same contact on multiple lists). Click Next to advance to the final step. Step 5: Review and Complete Import In this final step, you'll review all your import settings before finalizing: Review the summary information: The destination list or group Source assignment Field mapping summaryNumber of Phones on your Mojo DNC List Number of duplicates found (if checked) Make adjustments if needed: Click Back to return to previous steps Select Remap Data to go directly to the field mapping step View duplicate records by clicking Show in the duplicates section.View phone numbers flagged as DNC by clicking Show the Phones in the DNC section When everything looks correct, click Finish Import to complete the process. Conclusion By following these five steps, you can efficiently import your leads and contacts into the Mojo dialer system. This organized approach will help you maintain clean data while setting up your contact lists for successful calling campaigns. Remember that proper field mapping and duplicate management are key to maintaining high-quality contact data in your Mojo account. description: Importing Data Files into Mojo File Requirements Acceptable formats: Comma Separated Value (*.csv) - preferred Microsoft Excel (*.xls, *.xlsx) Phone number formatting: Each phone number must be in a single cell All phone numbers must use consistent ...
content: Importing Tips and Requirements Importing Data Files into MojoFile Requirements Acceptable formats: Comma Separated Value (*.csv) - preferred Microsoft Excel (*.xls, *.xlsx) Phone number formatting: Each phone number must be in a single cell All phone numbers must use consistent formatting: Either 5555555555 Or (555) 555-5555Or 555-555-5555 Data formatting guidelines: Avoid special characters when possible Left-justify all data in cellsData must be on Sheet 1 of the file Keep file size under 5 MB (split larger files) Import Tips for Success Organize your data files: Segment by List, Group, Source, and assigned Mojo user (manager) Review if additional miscellaneous fields are needed Simplify the mapping process: Use header rows with exact Mojo field names The header row should be on Row 1 of your fileThe data should be on Sheet 1 of your file How to fix a corrupt file:Copy the data from your fileOpen a New filePaste the data into the new fileSave and Name the file such that you can easily find it when importingTiming considerations: Import during non-working hours, especially for large files Allow extra time for processing (don't import right before user training) Avoid importing when users are active (for multiple user accounts) Related Articles How to import data into MojoHow to Import Spreadsheets of Leads and Contacts into Mojo Dialer Introduction Importing your leads and contacts into the Mojo dialer is a straightforward process that allows you to efficiently organize and manage your customer data. title: Mojo Voice
description: Mojo Voice Overview Mojo Voice is an optional add-on service that enables a seamless, built-in voice connection with the Mojo Dialer—no separate phone line or device is required. Key Features: Monthly Cost: $30 per month, per Mojo CRM user. Browser ...
content: Mojo Voice Mojo Voice OverviewMojo Voice is an optional add-on service that enables a seamless, built-in voice connection with the Mojo Dialer—no separate phone line or device is required.Key Features: Monthly Cost: $30 per month, per Mojo CRM user. Browser Compatibility: Works with Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Safari, and Microsoft Edge. Transferable License: The subscription can be reassigned to another user within your account if needed. Using Mojo Voice: After subscribing, you can choose to enable or disable Mojo Voice before each dialing session by checking a box in the dialer setup screen.When launching a dial session, your browser will prompt you to allow access to your microphone and headset. You must accept this permission to proceed.Once access is granted, you'll be able to: Select your preferred microphone and headset. Test your audio connection to ensure everything is working properly.Troubleshooting Tips: If you're unable to hear audio or your contacts can't hear you, double-check your headset and microphone connections. Confirm that your browser has microphone permissions enabled. You can adjust your Mojo Voice settings at any time through the dialer interface. Reference the settings screen (image provided) for guidance. content: Pausing and resuming your live dialing session How to Pause and Resume a Dialing Session in Mojo Why You Might Need to Pause You can temporarily pause your dialing session without ending it completely when you need to: Take a short break Handle an incoming callback Respond to a high-priority lead Pausing Your Session While actively dialing, locate the "Pause" button in the dialer toolbar Click the "Pause" button Your session remains active, but Mojo stops dialing new numbers Resuming Your Session When you're ready to continue dialing: Click the "Resume" button in the same location If prompted, select an appropriate call result button Your dialing session will continue from where you left off Benefits Pausing instead of ending your session allows you to: Maintain your place in your calling list Avoid setup time for a new session Better manage your workflow during interruptions Related Articles How to stop or end a call session effectivelyHow to Stop and End a Dialing Session Properly in Mojo Follow these steps to correctly end your dialing session: Complete your current call: Ensure your conversation has fully concluded Pause the session: Click the Pause button in the bottom left ... content: How to stop or end a call session effectively How to Stop and End a Dialing Session Properly in Mojo Follow these steps to correctly end your dialing session: Complete your current call: Ensure your conversation has fully concluded Pause the session: Click the Pause button in the bottom left corner of the dialing window Assign an appropriate call result for your most recent contact End the session: The system remains paused until you take further action Click the Stop button to officially end the session Alternatively, hang up your phone to terminate the connection Return to main screen: After stopping, you'll automatically be redirected to the data and dialer screen Following this procedure ensures all call data is properly recorded and your system is ready for your next dialing session. title: Activating Call Hammer to increase outreach success
description: How to Use the Call Hammer Feature to Call All Available Contact Numbers The Call Hammer feature helps you maximize contact opportunities by automatically trying all available phone numbers for a lead. Here's how it works: Automatic sequential ...
content: Activating Call Hammer to increase outreach success How to Use the Call Hammer Feature to Call All Available Contact Numbers The Call Hammer feature helps you maximize contact opportunities by automatically trying all available phone numbers for a lead. Here's how it works: Automatic sequential dialing: When activated, Call Hammer sequentially attempts all phone numbers associated with a contact Starts by dialing the first available number If unsuccessful, proceeds to the next number in sequence Continues until a connection is established or all numbers are attempted Benefits: Increases contact rates Saves time by eliminating manual redialing Ensures thorough follow-up with each lead Helps identify which contact methods work best for specific leads This feature is particularly useful for high-value leads where making contact is a priority and multiple phone numbers are available. title: Filtering your call session based on listing price
description: Using and Adjusting List Price Filters in Mojo You can filter leads by list price in three different ways: Option 1: Using Optional Dialing Filters Select your desired Calling List/Group in the Data & Dialer section Click the green Power Dialer ...
content: Filtering your call session based on listing price Using and Adjusting List Price Filters in Mojo You can filter leads by list price in three different ways: Option 1: Using Optional Dialing Filters Select your desired Calling List/Group in the Data & Dialer section Click the green Power Dialer button Look for the "Optional Dialing Filters" button on the right side of the Call Wizard Click this button to reveal the List Price filter Set your preferred price range: • For properties above a specific price: Enter your minimum in "From" (e.g., 1000000) and leave "To" blank • For properties below a specific price: Leave "From" blank and enter your maximum in "To" (e.g., 5000000) • For properties within a specific range: Fill both "From" and "To" (e.g., 100000 to 3000000) Option 2: Using Column Filters Navigate to the Data and Dialer section Find the List Price column header Click the Filter icon to the right of this header Set your desired price range using the same approach as above Save your filtered results to a Sublist for future use Option 3: Setting Filters During Purchase For certain lead types (such as FSBOs), you can set price filters directly in the Leadstore when purchasing: Simply enter your minimum price (e.g., 1000000) to receive only leads at or above that price point Related Articles Using calling filters for targeted calling in MojoTargeting Your Prospects with Mojo's Dialing Filters Mojo's dialing filters help you focus your outreach efforts on the most promising leads. title: How to switch between Power Dialer and Click to Call
description: Switching Between Power Dialer and Click-to-Call Sessions in Mojo Accessing Dialer Options Select your target list by navigating to the Data & Dialer section of your account Click the green Power Dialer button to open the Call Wizard setup screen ...
content: How to switch between Power Dialer and Click to Call Switching Between Power Dialer and Click-to-Call Sessions in Mojo Accessing Dialer Options Select your target list by navigating to the Data & Dialer section of your account Click the green Power Dialer button to open the Call Wizard setup screen Choosing Your Dialing Method Locate the two dialing option buttons on the right side of the Call Wizard: Start Power Dialer Start Click to Call Using Click-to-Call Mode Select the Click to Call option to dial contacts one by one The system will display brief instructions on how to advance to the next call Important note: If you're subscribed to the triple line dialer, the Click to Call function will automatically reduce the number of lines to 1 Returning to Power Dialer Mode When switching back to Power Dialer after using Click to Call, be sure to check and reset your line count if needed, as the system retains the single-line setting from your previous Click to Call session. This flexibility allows you to switch between high-volume calling and more deliberate, manual dialing based on your specific needs. content: Creating lead sheets for accurate data collection while on the phone Creating and Managing Lead Sheets in Mojo Creating a New Lead Sheet Access lead sheet settings by logging into Mojo and clicking the Menu icon in the bottom-left corner Navigate to Settings from the main menu Select Lead Sheets from the options on the top left Click "Add New Lead Sheet" to begin creating a new form Customizing Your Lead Sheet Add relevant fields to capture important information: Contact details (name, phone, email) Qualification data (motivation level, timeline) Property information (address, value, condition) Choose from various field types: Text boxes for open-ended responses Dropdown menus for predefined options Radio buttons for single-choice selections Checkboxes for multiple-choice selections Name your lead sheet with a descriptive internal title Click Save to store your completed lead sheet template Managing Existing Lead Sheets View all lead sheets from the Lead Sheets settings page Edit a lead sheet by clicking the 3 dots icon next to its name Delete a lead sheet by clicking the trash icon Custom lead sheets help standardize your data collection process and ensure you gather consistent information during prospect interactions. title: How to avoid calling linked contacts in your database to avoid duplicate calls
description: Overview When you have linked contacts in your database, you may want to avoid calling them during your dialing sessions. This feature prevents you from accidentally calling the same household multiple times. Disabling Calls to Linked Contacts ...
content: How to avoid calling linked contacts in your database to avoid duplicate calls Overview When you have linked contacts in your database, you may want to avoid calling them during your dialing sessions. This feature prevents you from accidentally calling the same household multiple times. Disabling Calls to Linked Contacts Navigate to Data and Dialer in the main menu Select the specific list or group you want to call Click the power dialer button to begin setting up your calling session Locate and click the Advanced Settings button in the bottom-left corner Ensure the "Allow dialing on linked contacts" option is unchecked When this setting is disabled, the system will skip any contacts that are linked to other records in your database during your dialing session, helping you avoid duplicate calls to the same household. content: Managing call back messages in Mojo Setting Up Call Back Messages in MojoSells Overview Call-back messages play to your target when more than one person picks up the phone as you are dialing out. This feature is optional and is only used during multi-line calling operations. Setup Process Access the message settings by logging into Mojo and clicking the Menu icon in the bottom-left corner Navigate to Settings from the main menu Select Messages from the options list Choose Callback Messages from the message types Click the Add Call Back Message button to create a new recording Recording Options Mobile Phone Recording: Scan the displayed QR code with your mobile device Click the link that appears after scanning Allow the browser access to your phone's microphone Web Recording: Use your computer's microphone to record directly in the browser Ensure your microphone permissions are enabled Finalizing Your Message Name your message with a descriptive title (examples: "General Callback" or "FSBO") Click Record to begin your recording Review your message by playing it back Click Save to store your completed message Creating specific callback messages for different scenarios helps personalize your follow-up communication with prospects, though remember that using callback messages is entirely optional for your multi-line calling workflow. title: Setting up the Zone Guard time zone settings in Mojo
description: Setting Your Time Zone in Mojo Overview Setting the correct time zone in Mojo ensures your calls, appointments, and activities display at the appropriate times and helps you stay compliant with calling regulations. Time Zone Setup Process Access ...
content: Setting up the Zone Guard time zone settings in Mojo Setting Your Time Zone in Mojo Overview Setting the correct time zone in Mojo ensures your calls, appointments, and activities display at the appropriate times and helps you stay compliant with calling regulations. Time Zone Setup Process Access settings by logging into Mojo and clicking the Menu icon in the bottom-left corner Navigate to Settings from the main menu Select Dialer Settings from the options Locate the Zone Guard section in the settings panel Choose the correct time range that corresponds to your location Important Note About Time Zones Time zones in the system are determined by the area code of the numbers being dialed, not by the homeowner or property address This ensures compliance with local calling regulations based on the recipient's likely time zone Maintaining an accurate time zone setting helps prevent accidental off-hours calls and ensures your schedule displays correctly throughout the system. title: Using calling filters for targeted calling in Mojo
description: Targeting Your Prospects with Mojo's Dialing Filters Mojo's dialing filters help you focus your outreach efforts on the most promising leads. Rather than calling everyone in your database, you can strategically select who to contact based on ...
content: Using calling filters for targeted calling in Mojo Targeting Your Prospects with Mojo's Dialing Filters Mojo's dialing filters help you focus your outreach efforts on the most promising leads. Rather than calling everyone in your database, you can strategically select who to contact based on priority, campaign needs, or previous interactions. Getting Started with Dialing Filters Navigate to the right screen • Open Mojo and go to the "Data and Dialer" screen • Select your calling list Access filtering options • Look for the "Dialing Filters" menu within your current calling list • Click to expand the filtering options Powerful Ways to Filter Your Calls Prioritize your most valuable leads Choose to call prospects by their assigned priority level (High, Medium, or Low) Start with high-priority contacts to maximize your success rate Align calls with your campaigns Select a specific action plan from the drop-down menu Focus only on prospects who match your current campaign objectives Avoid redundant outreach Filter out prospects you've already called today Ensure you're making fresh connections without repetition By applying these filters, you'll make more efficient calls and connect with the prospects most likely to respond positively to your outreach. content: How to manage call recordings in Mojo - Storage limits Mojo's Call Recording feature automatically saves recordings for all calls that end with these results: Contact, DNC, and DNC Contact. After completing your dialing session, these recordings become available in your Call Recording Report for listening, downloading, and management. Accessing Your Call Recordings You can access your call recordings in two ways: Through the Call Recording Report Go to Reports in Mojo Select Call Recording from the left navigation menu Choose which agent(s) you want to view Set your desired date range and click Apply Through Individual Contact Records Open the specific contact's record Navigate to the History tab View and manage call recordings directly from this section Important Storage Information ⚠️ Call recordings are automatically deleted after 90 days. Download any important recordings to your computer before they expire. Managing Storage Limits Regularly review your call recordings to identify which ones you need to keep Download important recordings promptly to avoid losing valuable information Consider implementing a filing system on your computer to organize downloaded recordings This streamlined guide should help you effectively manage your call recordings in Mojo, ensuring you never lose important conversation data. title: Required Network Ports for Mojo Dialer
description: Required Network Ports for Mojo Dialer To ensure proper connectivity and optimal performance of the Mojo Dialer, specific network ports must be open on your firewall or network settings. Failure to open these ports may result in connectivity issues, ...
content: Required Network Ports for Mojo Dialer Required Network Ports for Mojo Dialer To ensure proper connectivity and optimal performance of the Mojo Dialer, specific network ports must be open on your firewall or network settings. Failure to open these ports may result in connectivity issues, call drops, or poor call quality. Required Ports The following TCP and UDP ports must be open to allow the Mojo Dialer to establish a stable connection: Port Protocol Purpose 20708 TCP/IP Mojo Dialer communication 20808 TCP/IP Mojo Dialer communication 20718 TCP/IP Mojo Dialer communication 20818 TCP/IP Mojo Dialer communication Configuration Instructions Firewall Settings – Ensure that your network firewall allows both inbound and outbound traffic on the ports listed above. Router Settings – If using a router, confirm that port forwarding is configured correctly for these ports. VPN/Proxy Settings – If you are using a VPN or proxy service, verify that it does not block traffic on these ports. Troubleshooting If you experience issues connecting to the Mojo Dialer after configuring the network settings: Confirm that there are no additional firewall rules or security software blocking the ports. Test your network connection to rule out general connectivity issues. Restart your computer and network equipment after making changes. For further assistance, contact your office network administrator or your internet service provider support desk. content: Whitelisting Caller ID's Understanding and Implementing Caller ID Whitelisting Whitelisting your Caller ID helps prevent your calls from being marked as spam or blocked. Here's what you need to know about this complimentary Mojo service. What is Caller ID Whitelisting? A complimentary service offered by Mojo to help counter Spam Likely/STIR SHAKEN identification Mojo's partners monitor for spam tagging or call blocking and take action to clean your number Helps establish your number as trustworthy across carrier networks How to Whitelist Your Caller ID Navigate to Settings from the bottom left of your Mojo dashboard Select Caller ID/Mojo Caller ID from the left menu For existing Caller IDs: Find your number and click the Submit button under the Whitelisted column Check the box to have your Caller ID Whitelisted Enter your Caller ID Registration Name This will appear to approximately 10-15% of your contacts Must follow specific format (examples provided on the page) Primary purpose is to identify your number as trusted to phone carriers Check the box to agree to the terms and click Save For New Caller IDs When adding a new Caller ID, you'll be prompted during setup to whitelist it, following the same steps above. Processing Time Full whitelisting can take varying amounts of time depending on the phone carrier Typically complete after approximately 8 days Your number will be color-coded in the system to indicate its current whitelisting status Whitelisted numbers improve contact rates by reducing the likelihood of your calls being filtered or blocked by carrier spam protection systems. title: Mojo Caller ID
description: What is Mojo Caller ID? Mojo Caller ID is a virtual number service that allows you to use an alternative caller ID when making calls while still receiving return calls on your phone. It costs $10 per month per number with a month-to-month ...
content: Mojo Caller ID What is Mojo Caller ID? Mojo Caller ID is a virtual number service that allows you to use an alternative caller ID when making calls while still receiving return calls on your phone. It costs $10 per month per number with a month-to-month subscription. Benefits of STIR/SHAKEN Certification Mojo Caller ID enhances your outreach through verified, high-trust calls with STIR/SHAKEN certification. Your calls are transmitted with attestation level A (the highest certification), ensuring recipients recognize your calls as authentic and legitimate, resulting in better contact rates. Key Benefits Personalized, Verified Caller ID: Projects professionalism and builds trust by accurately identifying you to call recipients Highest STIR/SHAKEN Attestation Level A: Ensures maximum call authentication Improved Answer Rates: Verified, whitelisted caller ID increases the likelihood of calls being answered Reduced Spam Labeling: Fewer calls incorrectly flagged as spam means better contact engagement Enhanced Caller Reputation: Positions you as a trusted caller, boosting credibility Adding Mojo Caller ID Navigate to Settings from the bottom left of your Mojo dashboard Select Caller ID/Mojo Caller ID Click the Buy Mojo Caller ID button Agree to the terms and click Proceed to Checkout Select your state Choose an available Mojo Caller ID number from the dropdown If your area code isn't available, click the link to submit a request Enter a phone label (for your internal reference only) Enter your routing number (where return calls will be directed) Set up your Caller ID Registration Name This will display to 10-15% of your leads Your company name is the default, but alternative formats are availableRevisions must meet one the alternate format options Agree to the Whitelisting Terms Click Proceed to Checkout Answer the automated verification call from a 603 area code to your routing number and press 1 on your phone's dial pad Your Mojo Caller ID will be automatically whitelisted and ready to use after verification. title: Fixing Call Delays and Dead Air Pickups
description: Understanding and Optimizing Call Performance with Mojo Dialer Mojo Dialer delivers exceptional call quality through its direct connection to a Tier 1 carrier switch, outperforming standard VoIP systems. However, certain factors on your end may ...
content: Fixing Call Delays and Dead Air Pickups Understanding and Optimizing Call Performance with Mojo DialerMojo Dialer delivers exceptional call quality through its direct connection to a Tier 1 carrier switch, outperforming standard VoIP systems. However, certain factors on your end may introduce delays or dead air during calls. Here's how to identify and resolve these issues.Common Causes of Call Delays1. WiFi Calling on Mobile PhonesWiFi calling adds noticeable latency during rapid dialing sessions, even when imperceptible during standard calls. Solution: Disable WiFi calling in your phone settings Use a strong, stable cellular connection instead 2. LTE/VoLTE CallingLike WiFi calling, LTE/VoLTE uses data for voice transmission, which can compromise call quality during high-speed dialing. Solution: Check if your carrier allows disabling VoLTE in phone settings Use traditional cellular calling when possible 3. VoIP Phone Quality IssuesVoIP service quality varies significantly, with budget providers often experiencing inconsistent performance. Solution: Choose a premium VoIP provider known for low latencyChoose a service that is for "business-use" rather than "personal-use" Use wired internet connections rather than WiFi Avoid budget softphone solutions for Mojo dialing Request "Voice Priority" configuration from your network administrator or phone service provider Note for International Users: Geographic distance may introduce additional latency. Prioritize connection stability for best results. 4. Live Answer Beep SettingThis feature signals live answers but introduces a short delay before audio transmission begins. Solution: Disable Live Answer Beep in Mojo settings if immediate audio is critical Consider the tradeoff between notification benefits and conversation immediacy Quick Optimization Checklist Turn off WiFi calling on mobile devices Disable VoLTE if possible Use a quality VoIP provider or direct cellular connection Consider disabling Live Answer Beep for faster engagement If issues persist after making these adjustments, contact our support team for further assistance. content: Call Back Message Call Back Message Recording for Mojo Power DialingYou can manage Call Back messages for Mojo Power Dialing through the Settings screen, accessed by clicking Settings or Account Menu then Settings in the bottom left of the screen. This is specifically for multi-line dialing, in the event that a live person answers right after another line was answered.Call Back MessagesCreating Call Back messages for Power Dialing is optional but valuable when using multi-line dialing. Here's how they work: Plays when multi-line dialing connects to more than one live call When a live person on second line answers, they hear your recorded message After the message ends, the system disconnects that call The system automatically redials that contact when you finish with your first call Maximum message length: 10 seconds Recording Your Call Back Message Click Settings on the left Navigate to Messages from the left menu, then select Call Back message Click the Add Call Back Message button Choose how you would like to record your message You can record your message using two methods:Recording via Web: Allow access to your computer's microphone Name your message Click the record button Recording via Mobile: Scan the QR code displayed on screen with your mobile phone Allow access to your phone's microphone Name your message Click record An effective Call Back message reassures contacts that you'll call them back immediately, helping maintain their interest during multi-line dialing sessions. title: Call Recording Feature
description: Call Recording for Quality Assurance Call Recording is an optional Mojo Power Dialer add-on feature that helps you perform quality assurance checks on your staff. Recordings are available for 90 days and can be downloaded if needed. This feature ...
content: Call Recording Feature Call Recording for Quality AssuranceCall Recording is an optional Mojo Power Dialer add-on feature that helps you perform quality assurance checks on your staff. Recordings are available for 90 days and can be downloaded if needed. This feature automatically records and saves calls with the following call results: Contact DNC Contact DNC Number Adding Call Recording to Your Account Log in using an owner account Access Account by clicking the Menu button in the bottom left corner Navigate to Subscriptions in the left menu Click the plus (+) button to add the recording feature Select which agent you want to assign this subscription to Reassigning Call Recording to Different Agents Select the Agents tab from the left menu Click on the agent name that currently has Call Recording Deselect the checkbox for Call Recording When prompted, choose to remove or reassign this feature You can switch the Call Recording feature between different agents as needed for comprehensive quality assurance coverage. It would be effective on the next dial session they begin.Accessing Recorded CallsAfter calls are recorded during Power Dialing, you can access the recordings in two ways: From the Reports menu under the Call Recording icon Directly within the individual contact record of the lead, in the History sectionTroubleshooting Possible Call Recording IssuesIf the call recordings are not playing:Check to make sure that all audio points are connected and the volume is upSome browsers don't play the recordings and will require you to follow the instructions for downloading the files, which you can then play in your media playerIf the recording plays the beginning repeatedly, you may need to clear your browser cache and cookies. If the issue persists, download the file to play with your media playerIf you are unable to find a recording:Call Recording is specific to the assigned agent at the start of the dial session; Call Recording will be effective on the next dial session they begin after the subscription is assigned. Have the agent end a current dial session and start a new session if assigning or re-assigning a Call Recording subscriptionOnly calls completed as Contact, DNC Contact or DNC Number during the session are saved; review the Call Detail Report to determine the Result of the call in question. Particularly, check for Incomplete calls which the dial session was ended without clicking any of the Result buttons.Call Recordings can take some time to process, particularly if there are a lot of accounts dialing and recording.If a recording is still not showing the next day and it did meet all of the qualifications, the processing may have gotten stuck. Please reach out to our support team to report the issue.Recordings are saved for a period of 90 days (even if the subscription is cancelled or re-assigned during that time) then deleted, be sure to download any that are needed beyond the 90 days. title: Call Result Button Definitions
description: Understanding Mojo Call Results Mojo offers 16 possible call results categorized into two types: User-Controlled Call Results (8) Contact Use when you successfully reach your intended contact You can update their List or Group based on your ...
content: Call Result Button Definitions Understanding Mojo Call ResultsMojo offers 16 possible call results categorized into two types:User-Controlled Call Results (8)Contact Use when you successfully reach your intended contact You can update their List or Group based on your conversation No Contact – Next Record Use when you can't reach your target and want to move to the next record No Contact – Next Number Use when you can't reach the contact but want to try another number for them Only works when multiple numbers are available for the contact Bad Number Use when the number is out of service or reaches the wrong person Removes only that specific number while keeping the contact and other numbers in your list Drop Voicemail Use when you reach voicemail and want to leave your pre-recorded message No need to wait for the beep - select this option as soon as you confirm it's voicemail Voicemail Use to record that the call resulted in a voicemail connection Typically used when you haven't preselected an automated voicemail message DNC Contact Flags the entire contact and all associated phone numbers as Do Not Call Example: If a contact has three numbers, all three will be marked DNC DNC Number Flags only the specific phone number you called as Do Not Call Other numbers for the same contact remain eligible for dialing System-Generated Call Results (8)Skipped Appears when you select or click the "X" in the call box before connecting System skips the current call and moves to the next number No Answer Indicates Mojo dialed the number, waited for the specified number of rings, but no connection was made Incomplete Occurs when there's a live connection but your session is ended without selecting a result This happens if you lose internet connection during a call, your session is terminated for inactivity or if your call to the dialer is dropped or disconnected Fax Displayed when the system detects a fax tone Disconnected Indicates Mojo's system has identified a disconnected tone Busy Displayed when the system detects a busy tone Other Shown when the system detects an unrecognizable tone Occurs when the tone doesn't match standard telecommunications SS7 signaling codes Answering Machine If you're on a live call and another line reaches a voicemail or an automated system like a phone tree Mojo disconnects without leaving a message since the agent wasn't available to complete the call TroubleshootingIf you see Incomplete in the Activities section or call reports, this means either: Your dial session ended (eg agent hung up, call disconnected, an internet loss/disruption in the session or the session ended due to inactivity) without selecting a call result button There was a connection issue between your browser and the Mojo system (typically due to internet problems) Related Articles How to stop or end a call session effectivelyHow to Stop and End a Dialing Session Properly in Mojo Follow these steps to correctly end your content: Using the Power Dialer Using the Mojo Power Dialer: Complete Guide This guide walks you through using the Mojo Power Dialer effectively, from setup to call handling and follow-up features. Getting Started with Power Dialer Prerequisites Before using the Power Dialer, ensure you've completed: Account subscription configuration Dialer settings setup Data import to your Mojo account Accessing and Starting a Calling Session Select your target contacts: Choose the Property List, Calling List, or Group you want to call Click the Power Dialer button Configure your calling parameters: Select your Call Settings Choose which Easy Calling Mode to use Apply any optional dialing filters Click the Start Dialing button Connect to the dialing server using one of these methods: Wait for an incoming call at the specified number (if using the "Call Me" account feature) Call the provided phone number and enter your PIN when prompted Managing Calls and Results Call Result Options For each call, select the appropriate result: Contact - You reached the person you were looking for No Contact (Next Number) - Person unavailable; try their secondary number immediately No Contact (Next Record) - Person unavailable; skip to a different contact record Voicemail - Leave a message on answering machine or voicemail Bad Number - Wrong number, disconnected, or fax line; removes this number from contact details DNC Contact - Flags all numbers for this contact as Do Not Call DNC Number - Marks only the dialed number as Do Not Call Moving Contacts Between Groups To move a contact to a new Group, single-click to select the destination Group To remove from current Group, select both the new Group first then the old Group Selecting a List will remove the contact from any Groups (contacts cannot be in both a List and Group) Session Control Options Stop - End the dialing session while remaining logged into the dialer Pause - Temporarily halt dialing for 6-7 minutes after the current dials are complete (session disconnects automatically if not resumed) Hang Up - Disconnect from the current call Ending Your Session Click OK on the confirmation dialog when all numbers have been dialed To exit completely, click the red X icon in the top right corner To start a new session, select new Call Settings and click Start Dialing Advanced Features Redialing a Contact While still connected to the contact, click the Redial button (it turns red) Select a call result to end the current call The system will automatically redial the specified contact To cancel a redial, click the red Redial button again before ending the call Hide Dialerclick Hide Dialer (below the Stop button) to collapse the dialer to a small section at the bottom left of your Data & Dialer screen *the dialer screen will automatically expand to full size upon a live answerclick Expand Dialer (below the Stop button) to expand the dialer to full size Related Articles Power Dialer ConfigurationConfiguring Mojo Power Dialer for Optimal Calling Sessions Mojo's Power Dialer offers flexible configuration options for each calling session. title: Power Dialer Configuration
description: Configuring Mojo Power Dialer for Optimal Calling Sessions Mojo's Power Dialer offers flexible configuration options for each calling session. You can call all leads sequentially, resume from where you left off, or use custom filters to target ...
content: Power Dialer Configuration Configuring Mojo Power Dialer for Optimal Calling Sessions Mojo's Power Dialer offers flexible configuration options for each calling session. You can call all leads sequentially, resume from where you left off, or use custom filters to target specific segments of your contact list. Basic Call Settings Caller ID: Select which phone number appears to contacts Includes Mojo Caller ID numbers if you've subscribed Voice Mail Message: Choose the pre-recorded message to leave when reaching voicemail Call Back Message: Select message played during multi-line dialing when multiple lines connect Number of Lines: Choose how many simultaneous lines to use Ring Count: Set how many rings before disconnecting 6-7 rings typically connects to more answering machines/voicemails Easy Calling Mode Options Call from where the last session left off, starting with new leads first Resumes from your previous stopping point Prioritizes any new leads added since last session Prevents redundant calls to recently contacted leads Popular for expired and off-market data Call from top to bottom regardless of where the last session left off Starts from the beginning of your list Calls in order from newest to oldest records Disregards previous stopping points Optional Dialing Filters Click the Optional Dialing Filters button to refine your call targeting: Call Hammer: Calls all available numbers for a contact until you get a result or exhaust all numbers Stop Call Attempts: Set maximum attempt limits (e.g., only call records with 0-10 attempts) Not Dialed: Call only records not dialed within your specified timeframe Not Contacted: Target records without successful contact in your specified timeframe Great for regular SOI and Past Client outreach Voicemail Msg Skip: Avoid leaving duplicate messages by skipping records where you've already left specific messages Create Date: Target records created within a specific date range Status Change: Call records with status changes within a specific date range List Price: Set minimum and maximum property list price parameters Auto Send Emails Set up automatic email sending based on call results: Configure which email template sends based on specific call results Example: When marking a call as "Contact," the system automatically sends your "Nice talking with you" email template Requires contact to have an email address in their recordMay require additional setup of SMTP or Gmail API for the agent to send emails, depending on their email service provider These configurations help maximize your calling efficiency and ensure complete list coverage. content: Managing your billing subscriptions Managing Your Subscriptions in Mojo Overview The Subscriptions page in Mojo provides a central location to view and manage all your active services, including Dialer, Data, and Mojo Caller ID subscriptions. How to Access Your Subscriptions Click the Account icon in the bottom left corner of Mojo Select Subscriptions from the left navigation panel On this page, you'll see your Dialer Subscription at the top and any Mojo Data or Caller ID subscriptions at the bottom. Managing Your Dialer Subscription Your Dialer Subscription section displays key information: Your next bill date Total amount due To modify your subscription: Add services: Click the plus (+) icon next to your subscription Remove services: Click the minus (-) icon next to your subscription Important Billing Notes for Dialer Adding services: Costs are prorated based on your current billing cycle Removing services: Changes take effect immediately with no prorated refund Best practice: Wait until the day before your next bill date to remove services to maximize paid time Managing Mojo Data & Caller ID Subscriptions At the bottom of the page, you'll find your active Data and Caller ID subscriptions showing: Renewal date Billing amount Subscription status Unsubscribing from Data & Caller ID Services Click the Unsubscribe button to cancel these services For Recurring Payment Plans for Mojo Data, click Manage Discount Important Billing Notes for Data & Caller ID Data and Caller ID services have separate billing cycles from your Dialer Subscription Service periods begin on signup day with their own unique renewal dates No refunds for early cancellations - services remain active until the end of your prepaid period To purchase new data services, visit the Leadstore To purchase Mojo Caller ID services, go to Settings > Caller ID/Mojo Caller ID If you have questions about your subscriptions, contact our support team for assistance. content: How to flag a contact as a lead in Mojo for reporting and tracking How to Use Lead Tags to Organize Contacts To tag a contact as a 'Lead' in Mojo, you simply designate up to 3 contact groups in Mojo as a lead group. When you assign a contact to one of the groups you've designated as a lead group, the system will tag that contact as a Lead and update reports. Designating lead Groups: In the Data & Dialer section, you can mark up to 3 Groups as lead designators Click the 3 vertical dots to the right of any Group Select "Edit/Designate Lead" Check the box next to "Designate Leads" option Automatic tracking: Once you've designated these Groups, any contacts assigned to them will be: Tracked as Leads in your Reports Visible in your Prospecting Dashboard Easily identifiable in your contact management system This organization system helps you prioritize follow-ups and track conversion metrics for your most important contacts. content: How to create targeted calling lists and groups Building Targeted Lead Lists Using Custom Criteria in MojoSells Overview Sublists and Sub-Groups in Mojo allow you to create highly targeted calling lists based on specific filtering criteria. These filtered lists help you focus your outreach on the most relevant prospects. Creating Filtered Sublists/Sub-Groups Select your base list by navigating to the Data & Dialer section Click the 3-line FILTER icon located to the right of any column header you want to filter by Enter specific filter values for each column you want to include: Listing Status Status Change Date City Price Range Any other relevant criteria Click the green Save Sublist/Subgroup button in the top-right corner Name your new Sublist/Subgroup with a descriptive title that indicates its purpose Using Your Filtered Lists Once created, your new Sublist/Subgroup will appear in your list of available calling lists. You can select this targeted list when setting up your dialing session to ensure you're only calling contacts who meet your specific criteria. Creating targeted Sublists/Sub-Groups helps improve contact relevance and conversion rates by focusing your calling efforts on prospects most likely to respond to your specific message. content: How to categorize leads and contacts Understanding Mojo's Record Organization System Mojo organizes your contacts into three distinct categories that guide leads through your sales pipeline: Properties List Houses unqualified real estate-specific data including: Expired and Off Market leads FSBOs and FRBOs Pre-Foreclosure listings Automatically filters records into sublists based on listing status Records move between sublists as their statuses change Note: Only visible to real estate users receiving data from vendors like Mojo, Vulcan 7, Redx, MyPlusLeads, or Landvoice Calling Lists Contains general unqualified leads from various sources: Excel file imports Neighborhood Search tool results Cold call list providers (Coles, Telelisting, etc.) Serves as the initial repository for non-real estate specific contacts Groups Designed for qualified contacts and existing relationships: People you've spoken with Past clients Sphere of influence contacts When moved to a Group, records are removed from their original Properties List or Calling List Records can move between different Groups as they progress through qualification Mojo provides several premade Groups: Appointment Set Hot Lead Not Interested Trash Custom Groups can be created in the Data & Dialer section This organizational structure helps you effectively manage contacts at different stages of your lead generation and follow-up process. content: How to handle and resolve duplicate leads in Mojo How to Handle and Resolve Duplicate Leads in Mojo:If you have duplicate leads and want to clean them up, you can use Mojo's Find Duplicates feature to streamline your database.How to Find and Manage Duplicates:In Mojo, go to Data and DialerClick on the Find Duplicates button at the bottom of the pageChoose your preferred duplicate search criteria: Full Name, Phone, Email, and/or Property AddressSelect the List(s) or Group(s) you want to search, or choose Entire DatabaseYou can select multiple lists/groups by holding the Ctrl (Windows) or Cmd (Mac) key while selectingClick SearchManaging Duplicates:Review the results and delete any leads you no longer needLink records together to easily toggle between them and see all information in one placeIf linked records are in the same calling list, Mojo will prevent duplicate calls to the same contact within a dialing sessionThis tool helps keep your database clean and efficient. description: Understanding Lists, Groups, Sublists, and Folders This knowledge base article explains how to organize contacts in your real estate CRM system, distinguishing between unqualified leads and qualified contacts with clear organization methods. Lists: ...
content: Organizing Your Database Understanding Lists, Groups, Sublists, and FoldersThis knowledge base article explains how to organize contacts in your real estate CRM system, distinguishing between unqualified leads and qualified contacts with clear organization methods.Lists: For Unqualified LeadsLists contain people you've never spoken with or qualified. There are two main types:Properties Calling List Contains unqualified leads posted from vendors (Mojo Expired, Vulcan 7, RedX, Landvoice, or My +Plus Leads) Leads automatically filter into sublists they qualify for (Expired, Cancelled, FSBO, etc.) Note: This feature may not appear if you're not in Real Estate or not using these specific vendors Calling Lists Lists you create by: Importing a spreadsheet Using Neighborhood Search Syncing from Coles, Landvoice FSBO, or Telelisting Should only contain unqualified leads Groups: For Qualified ContactsGroups help organize contacts after you've qualified them through phone conversations: When you qualify someone on the phone, assign them to appropriate groups This removes them from call lists, preventing mixing with unqualified leads Use default groups (Hot Lead, Warm Lead, Not Yet Interested) or create custom ones Some users prefer simple categories (Yes, No, Maybe), while others use more specific groupings Allows you to reassess and update group assignments after each conversation Helps maintain organized nurturing systems for your contacts Sublists: For Filtered ViewsSublists extract specific data from lists or groups based on set criteria: Data remains in the original list/group but appears filtered in the sublist Contacts may appear in multiple sublists if they meet different criteria Example: Create a sublist of Expired Property leads specifically in Boston Can be created using any value shown in the main data grid If needed fields aren't visible, you can add/remove columns in the data grid Folders: For OrganizationFolders help organize your calling lists or groups: Useful for team accounts where each agent needs their own lists/groups Helps categorize lists/groups into specific categories Simplifies navigation when you have numerous lists/groups Provides a cleaner, more organized workspace Related Articles How to create targeted calling lists and groupsBuilding Targeted Lead Lists Using Custom title: Setting up a follow-up Action Plan
description: Automating Your Follow-Ups with Mojo Action Plans Consistent follow-up is crucial for converting leads, but it's time-consuming to manage manually. Mojo Action Plans automate this process, creating systematic workflows that ensure your prospects ...
content: Setting up a follow-up Action Plan Automating Your Follow-Ups with Mojo Action Plans Consistent follow-up is crucial for converting leads, but it's time-consuming to manage manually. Mojo Action Plans automate this process, creating systematic workflows that ensure your prospects receive timely communication without requiring constant attention from your team. Why Automated Follow-Ups Transform Your Business Never miss a touchpoint with automated sequences that maintain regular contact with every prospect Reclaim valuable time by automating repetitive outreach tasks while you focus on meaningful conversations Grow without growing pains by managing follow-ups for hundreds or thousands of contacts with the same effort Keep it personal with tailored sequences designed for different prospect types and scenarios Setting Up Your First Action Plan Access the Action Plans area Navigate to the Action Plans section in Mojo Click "Create New Plan" to begin building your sequence Build your follow-up sequence Add various communication methods to your plan: Emails with pre-written templates Task reminders for phone calls or personal outreach Scheduled calls that appear in your calling queue Physical mail touchpoints for additional impact Set your timing strategy Determine when each action occurs Create intervals between touchpoints (like "3 days after previous step") Schedule specific calendar dates for time-sensitive actions Enhance with AI insights (Optional) Let Mojo's AI analyze your engagement data Receive recommendations for optimal timing and sequence order Automatically adjust your plan based on prospect behavior Activate for your contacts Assign your action plan to individual prospects or groups Watch as Mojo executes each step automatically Track completion and monitor which steps progress to the next action With a well-designed Action Plan, you'll maintain professional consistency in your follow-ups while freeing yourself to focus on the most promising opportunities. Related Articles Creating an Action PlanCreating Action Plans in Mojo Access the Action Plan Area Click Settings on the bottom left of your Mojo screen Click the Action Plans tab on the left Click the Create button Step 1: Basic Setup Name your Action Plan Choose your scheduling type: ... title: Creating an Action Plan
description: Creating Action Plans in Mojo Access the Action Plan Area Click Settings on the bottom left of your Mojo screen Click the Action Plans tab on the left Click the Create button Step 1: Basic Setup Name your Action Plan Choose your scheduling type: ...
content: Creating an Action Plan Creating Action Plans in Mojo Access the Action Plan Area Click Settings on the bottom left of your Mojo screen Click the Action Plans tab on the left Click the Create button Step 1: Basic Setup Name your Action Plan Choose your scheduling type: Frequency Based - intervals between actions Date Based - specific calendar dates Select scheduling logic: Non-Strict Order - each step is scheduled regardless of missed steps Strict Order - each step must be completed in order before the next step is scheduled Set Weekend Option - decide if actions can be scheduled on weekends Step 2: Define Action Steps Select your action step types: Follow Up Calls Drip Emails Tasks Printing Letters Printing Labels Combine multiple different step types or use just one type throughout Schedule when steps should occur: Frequency based: Intervals of days Date based: Specific calendar dates Optional: Assign specific steps to a manager Step 3: Set Up Triggers (Optional) Decide if you want automatic assignment of the Action Plan Select what will trigger the plan: Property Calling List Calling List Group Use existing lists/groups or create new ones Choose whether contacts should be removed from the Action Plan if they're removed from the triggerIf you opt for "None" you must manually assign the leads to the Action Plan Step 4: Configure End Logic Select how contacts should be handled when the Action Plan completes Options include: Do Nothing (contacts are automatically removed from the Action Plan on the last date/when the number of days has elapsed)Repeat the Action Plan (specify when to restart) Automatically start a different Action Plan (select which one and when to start) Assign contacts to a specific group (select the appropriate group) Related Articles Action Plan OverviewUsing Action Plans in Mojo Action Plans are customizable follow-up sequences that help you maintain consistent communication with your contacts. These plans can include various steps such as calls, drip emails, tasks, letters and labels. You can ... title: Action Plan Overview
description: Using Action Plans in Mojo Action Plans are customizable follow-up sequences that help you maintain consistent communication with your contacts. These plans can include various steps such as calls, drip emails, tasks, letters and labels. You can ...
content: Action Plan Overview Using Action Plans in MojoAction Plans are customizable follow-up sequences that help you maintain consistent communication with your contacts. These plans can include various steps such as calls, drip emails, tasks, letters and labels. You can create simple plans with just one type of action or comprehensive plans combining multiple action types.After Creating an Action Plan Individual Assignment: Assign an Action Plan to contacts one at a time Bulk Assignment: Apply an Action Plan to: An entire list A specific group Selected contacts within a list or group How Action Plans Work All steps are automatically scheduled for the assigned contact(s) Mojo reminds you when steps are due through the Calendar area Action completion methods: Follow-up calls can be made using the dialer Letters and labels can be mass printed Tasks can be marked complete as you perform them Drip emails are sent automatically without manual intervention This systematic approach ensures consistent follow-up with your contacts while minimizing the manual effort required to maintain your communication schedule.
