Follow these steps: Navigate to the Data & Dialer screen by clicking the Data & Dialer button Select one or more contacts from your contact list Move the contacts to DNC using either method: Click the Move to button at the bottom of the screen and select Move to DNC Right-click on the selected contacts and choose Move to DNC from the context menu In the confirmation dialog, select all phone numbers or individual ones you wish to add to the DNC list Click OK to confirm and complete the process The selected contacts will now appear in your Do Not Call list, and the system will prevent these numbers from importing again and outbound calls to these numbers. title: Troubleshooting Follow Up Boss and Mojo Integration Problems
description: Resolving Follow Up Boss (FUB) Integration Issues with Mojo Integrating Follow Up Boss (FUB) with Mojo Dialer enhances your ability to manage and follow up with leads effectively. However, some users may encounter issues where leads within Mojo are ...
content: Troubleshooting Follow Up Boss and Mojo Integration Problems Resolving Follow Up Boss (FUB) Integration Issues with MojoIntegrating Follow Up Boss (FUB) with Mojo Dialer enhances your ability to manage and follow up with leads effectively. However, some users may encounter issues where leads within Mojo are not syncing properly with FUB. This article provides a detailed guide on troubleshooting these issues and ensuring smooth integration.Understanding the Integration ProcessThe integration between Follow Up Boss (FUB) and Mojo requires several steps to ensure leads are syncing properly. After securing your FUB API Key, the subsequent steps involve managing Stages and Smart Lists to determine how information flows between the two platforms.Setting Up IntegrationTo begin, make sure to access your Integration Settings within Mojo. Navigate through the following path: Settings → Integrations → Follow Up Boss. Here, you will find your FUB API Key along with the options to manage Stages and Smart Lists. Correct configuration of these elements is crucial to ensure leads are transferred accurately and efficiently.Managing StagesBy clicking on Manage Stages, you will see all Stages from your FUB account. It is important to decide the synchronization option for each stage:Not Sync: Chosen stages won’t be synchronized.One-way (FUB → Mojo): Leads in this stage from FUB will synchronize into Mojo.Two-way (Mojo ↔ FUB): Any changes in either FUB or Mojo will reflect on both platforms.Correctly syncing these stages helps ensure the necessary data travels between your FUB and Mojo accounts smoothly.Managing Smart ListsManaging Smart Lists involves selecting the lists you wish to sync with Mojo. It is important to remember that:Smart Lists must contain fewer than 2,000 contacts due to FUB restrictions. Lists larger than this will not sync.Any desirable Smart List must be initially configured in FUB and cannot be edited within Mojo.Once synced, it allows dialing directly from Mojo and categorized groups corresponding to your Stages or Smart Lists.Important ConsiderationsWhen working with this integration, consider that FUB transmits data to Mojo at a rate of 1,000 leads per hour. To avoid overloading the system, it's advisable to sync data in manageable, smaller batches. This pacing helps ensure that all updates are processed smoothly and efficiently.Additionally, while you may manage which contacts are part of your Smart Lists from within FUB, Mojo provides the functionality to make calls directly after these lists are synced and arranged. Individual contacts from Mojo can also be sent back into FUB by assigning them to a particular Stage Group.Troubleshooting Email Changes and Integration UpdatesIf changes to your email or user information are required:Log into your FUB account using your most recent email.Navigate to the Account section.Click Edit Information to modify your email, ensuring it aligns with your current user requirements.After updating, use the new email credentials for future logins.By maintaining updated login information, you ensure continuity in accessing both Mojo and FUB and that integration updates proceed unobstructed.ConclusionEfficiently managing Follow Up Boss and Mojo integration requires precise setup of API Key usage, Stage and Smart List synchronization, and accommodating potential FUB limitations. By following the outlined steps and monitoring data transfer rates, users can seamlessly manage leads across both applications, ensuring enhanced productivity and follow-up efficiency.For any additional support or personalization of your integration settings, it is recommended to consult with the respective platform's customer service team, who may provide customized assistance tailored to your specific needs. title: Mojo Data Use Case and Unauthorized Use Prevention
description: Recent audits uncovered clients using our data outside the agreed terms at sign-up. These violations jeopardize our entire lead delivery platform, risking termination by our partners who have specific acceptable use cases. These narrow use cases ...
content: Mojo Data Use Case and Unauthorized Use Prevention Recent audits uncovered clients using our data outside the agreed terms at sign-up. These violations jeopardize our entire lead delivery platform, risking termination by our partners who have specific acceptable use cases. These narrow use cases enable us to acquire high-quality data at a discount, benefiting our customers. Specifically, Mojo Neighborhood Search and Skip Tracer data fall within this limited scope.To address this issue, we will take the following steps:Review and strengthen our terms of service to clearly outline acceptable use cases and the consequences of non-compliance.Communicate with the clients who breached the terms, reminding them of the agreed-upon use cases and emphasizing the importance of adherence.Enhance monitoring and auditing procedures to identify any unauthorized data usage.Implement measures to prevent unauthorized transfers of Neighborhood Search and Skip Tracer data, such as blocking middleware programs and limiting exporting from the Mojo system.Work with our providers to enable controlled exporting for typical use cases, allowing data transfer through middleware and direct integration.We expect to have an agreement in place near future which will allow us to send Neighborhood Search and Skip tracer data via middleware and direct integrations using a modified approach more inline with our clients needs. We appreciate your patience as we resolve these issues while prioritizing the interests of our customers and Mojo's reputation. -The Mojo Management Team Related Articles Troubleshooting Follow Up Boss and Mojo Integration ProblemsResolving Follow Up Boss (FUB) Integration Issues with Mojo Integrating Follow Up Boss (FUB) with Mojo Dialer enhances your ability to manage and follow up with leads effectively. content: Mail Chimp Mojo has created a feature that allows users to send their contact data from Mojo to their Mail Chimp marketing service account. ConfigurationUse the following procedure to setup this service:Click the Integrations button located left of your Mojo screen.Select Mail Chimp on the left menu. Pushing Data to Mail ChimpUse the following procedure to send Mojo records to a MailChimp list: Click the Data & Dialer button. title: How to Find Past Called Contacts Easily
description: How to Retrieve and Review Your Call Log In sales and customer contact environments, recording accurate notes about your interactions is vital for follow-up and maintaining good relationships. Sometimes, issues like unsaved notes or accidentally ...
content: How to Find Past Called Contacts Easily How to Retrieve and Review Your Call LogIn sales and customer contact environments, recording accurate notes about your interactions is vital for follow-up and maintaining good relationships. Sometimes, issues like unsaved notes or accidentally closed windows can disrupt this process. This guide helps you access call logs and retrieve information from calls you may have recently made or lost. Follow the step-by-step instructions below to find your needed contact logs efficiently.Accessing Call Logs via Call Detail ReportIf you find yourself in a situation where your notes were unsaved or a call window was prematurely closed, you can still locate the contact through the Call Detail Report. This tool provides comprehensive information about each call made, including the name of the contact and the time of the call. Here’s how to navigate the Call Detail Report:Step-by-Step Process Generating the Call Detail Report Begin by accessing the Reports section in Mojo. From there, generate the Call Detail Report for the specific date range or interval during which the call took place. This report will list all outgoing calls within the specified parameters. Sorting and Searching the Call Log Upon opening the report, the most recent calls will appear at the top of the list by default. If you remember the name of the contact, you can quickly scan through the top entries. Alternatively, use the Search function to type “Contact” in the search bar. This action will filter the results to show all interactions, categorized under Contact, No Contact, and Do Not Contact. For efficiency, sort the results to display all "Contact" entries at the top. This should help to quickly pinpoint the interaction you need to review. Reviewing and Managing Contacts Once you identify the desired contact, double-click on the name. This action opens up the contact form, allowing you to review any existing data and manage the lead effectively. You can also add additional notes if necessary, ensuring that all pertinent information is documented. Tips for Effective UseAlways ensure that notes are posted accurately after completing the interaction with a lead before proceeding with further calls.Regularly backing up your call records or exporting reports can be a good practice to prevent data loss in volatile environments.Final InsightsHandling unsaved notes and retrieving contact logs doesn’t have to be a cumbersome task. By utilizing tools like the Call Detail Report, you can regain access to potentially lost interactions and ensure your follow-up processes remain intact. Leveraging these tools effectively will help you maintain a comprehensive record of your sales activities and enhance customer interaction efficiency.Remember, keeping organized and familiarizing yourself with the report functionalities can significantly streamline your workflow. title: Finding and removing duplicate records
description: How to Manage Duplicates in MojoSells Finding Duplicates Access the duplicate finder by logging into Mojo and navigating to the Data and Dialer section Select "Find Duplicates" from the options at the bottom of the page Set your search parameters: ...
content: Finding and removing duplicate records How to Manage Duplicates in MojoSells Finding Duplicates Access the duplicate finder by logging into Mojo and navigating to the Data and Dialer section Select "Find Duplicates" from the options at the bottom of the page Set your search parameters: Choose matching criteria (phone number, email, or full name) Select search scope (specific list, group, or entire database) Click the search button to begin the scanning process Review the results when Mojo displays all identified duplicates Managing Duplicate Records Once duplicates are identified, you have two main options: Link Records: Click the chain icon next to records you want to connect This preserves both records while creating an association between them Delete Duplicates: Click the red X icon next to any record you want to remove This permanently deletes the selected record from your Mojo databaseCan copy/paste pertinent data from one to the other if needed before deleting Managing duplicates regularly helps maintain data integrity and improves the efficiency of your contact management system. Mojo does not have a merging function. content: Keeping on top of your activities with the activity stream Viewing and Managing Today's Activities in MojoSells Overview Your Activity Stream in Mojo keeps you updated on all recent activities within your account. This guide explains how to efficiently access, view, and manage your daily tasks through the Today's Activities feature. Accessing Your Activities Log in to your MojoSells account You'll automatically arrive at the landing screen (Notification Screen) This screen displays important updates and recent activity Find the "Today's Activities Overview" section This section highlights all upcoming appointments, pending tasks, and required follow-ups Activities are organized chronologically by default Understanding Activity Prioritization Activities in Mojo use a simple color-coding system: 🔴 Red – High Priority tasks requiring immediate attention 🟡 Yellow – Medium Priority tasks 🟢 Green – Low Priority tasks Managing Your Activities View your full schedule by navigating to the Calendar section Sort activities by priority by clicking the Priority column header in Calendar view Manage individual tasks by clicking on any activity to: Reschedule for a different time Mark as completed Add notes or additional information Following this workflow will help you effectively track and manage all your daily activities in Mojo. content: Monitoring agent performance and activities Mojo Reports and Performance Monitoring Tools Mojo offers several powerful tools to track performance metrics and agent activity. Here's how to leverage them effectively: Activity Stream Dashboard Located on the Home page when you first log in Provides quick dialing stats and activity overview for the past 7 days View data for the entire account or filter by individual agent Shows brief dial session summaries including: Total time spent on the dialer Total calls made Total contacts achieved per session Also displays record changes, deletions, exports, and recent notes Comprehensive Reports Access detailed metrics through the Reports section in the left menu bar: Call Detail Report Identifies who you called and each call's outcome View statistics by individual agent or team Filter by specific time frames Track contacts made, call results, and contact percentages Session Report Perfect for team environments to evaluate agent performance Analyzes call results and time allocation Provides breakdown of: Total dialer time Total talk time Pause duration during sessions Shows call result frequency patterns Call Recording Report Available with the optional call recording subscription Lists recorded calls with results of Contact, DNC Contact, and DNC Number Allows easy access to all saved conversations Agent Time Sheet Tracks employees who use Mojo but may not always use the dialer Monitors total log-in time in the Mojo program Helps maintain accountability for overall system usage These reporting tools give you comprehensive visibility into performance metrics and system activity, helping you optimize your team's effectiveness. title: Call Recording Report
description: Call Recording Report: Listen Back and Learn with Mojo Dialer The Call Recording Report in Mojo lets you access and manage recordings of your calls—provided you’re subscribed to the optional Call Recording feature. This report captures calls with ...
content: Call Recording Report Call Recording Report: Listen Back and Learn with Mojo Dialer The Call Recording Report in Mojo lets you access and manage recordings of your calls—provided you’re subscribed to the optional Call Recording feature. This report captures calls with these results: Contact, DNC Contact, and DNC Number. Here’s what you’ll find in the report: Agent Name Contact Full Name Call Duration Call Result Date How to View Your Call Recordings Click the Reports button on your Mojo dashboard. Select Call Recording. Choose Agent(s) and a time frame. The report will automatically display. Click the Play button next to any recording to listen. You can pause, rewind, or fast-forward using your mouse. Tip: You can also find call recordings under the History section of individual contact records at the bottom of the screen. Downloading Call Recordings Mojo keeps your call recordings for 90 days. If you want to save them longer, you’ll need to download them as MP3 files. Here’s how to download: Click the Reports button. Go to the Call Recording report to see the list of recordings. Click on the recording you want to download—or check the box to select all. Click the Download button to save the recordings to your computer. Once downloaded: The files can be played on any media player that supports MP3 format. 🎧 And that’s it! Managing your call recordings is a breeze with Mojo. title: Mojo slow to load groups, lists or pages
description: Troubleshooting Delays When Moving Between Folders in Mojo If you're experiencing slowness or delays when navigating between lists, groups and pages in Mojo, there are several possible causes. This article will help you identify and resolve them ...
content: Mojo slow to load groups, lists or pages Troubleshooting Delays When Moving Between Folders in MojoIf you're experiencing slowness or delays when navigating between lists, groups and pages in Mojo, there are several possible causes. This article will help you identify and resolve them quickly. Common Causes: 1. Large quantities of data in groups or lists being loaded. Folders containing thousands of leads take longer to load, especially if there are notes, multiple group assignments or activity logs. 2. Mojo is cloud based. A slow or inconsistent connection will cause lag when loading lists and groups. 3. Browser Outdated. Make sure your browser is fully updated to the most current version. Mojo is constantly optimized for the latest browser configurations. Ideally, use Google Chrome ot access Mojo with minimal extensions or add-ons.4. Cached Data. Not closing and reopening Mojo can create issues with aged cached data. Old or corrupted cache/cookies will cause slow load times. 5. Mojo server load. In rare cases, Mojo may have an event on the server you are connected to which creates a lag. These are temporary and do not persist. If you feel this is the reason for your latency, and you've ruled out the issues above, please call us at 877-859-6656. title: Troubleshooting adding caller ID issues
description: Fixing Caller ID Issues in Mojo Overview A verified Caller ID is essential for using the Mojo dialer. If you're experiencing issues with the verification process, several common phone settings may be preventing successful verification. ...
content: Troubleshooting adding caller ID issues Fixing Caller ID Issues in Mojo Overview A verified Caller ID is essential for using the Mojo dialer. If you're experiencing issues with the verification process, several common phone settings may be preventing successful verification. Troubleshooting Verification Call Issues Check your phone settings if you're unable to receive the verification call: Ensure Do Not Disturb is switched OFF Verify that Ignore Unknown Callers is switched OFF These settings can block incoming verification calls from reaching your device Important Verification Requirements Caller ID MUST be verified before it can be used with the Mojo dialer Calls routing directly to voicemail will not complete verification Issues with calls going straight to voicemail must be resolved on your phone's end: Check carrier settings Ensure voicemail is not set to immediate forwarding Verify signal strength in your location Resolving these issues will allow the verification call to connect properly, enabling you to complete the Caller ID verification process and begin using the Mojo dialer. title: How to deal with call quality issues
description: How to Improve Call Quality and Bad Connections Mojo delivers exceptional call quality through its First Hello technology, which connects calls over traditional copper line infrastructure rather than VoIP. However, your own setup can significantly ...
content: How to deal with call quality issues How to Improve Call Quality and Bad Connections Mojo delivers exceptional call quality through its First Hello technology, which connects calls over traditional copper line infrastructure rather than VoIP. However, your own setup can significantly impact call performance. Follow these recommendations to optimize your calling experience: Mobile Phone Users Turn off WiFi Calling WiFi Calling uses internet connections that can create delays when making rapid calls Use your cellular network instead for more reliable connections Disable VoLTE/LTE Calling These features transmit voice over data networks, potentially introducing latency Check your phone settings to turn off LTE/VoLTE calling features VoIP Phone Users Select a business-grade VoIP provider with low latency and high reliability Use wired Ethernet connections instead of WiFi to avoid congestion issues Request voice traffic prioritization from your network provider Headset Recommendations Choose high-quality wired headsets for better stability than Bluetooth alternatives Avoid using speakerphone for extended calls as it can create echo effects and sometimes trigger unintended tones Mojo Settings Optimization Consider disabling Live Answer Beep in Settings if you notice delayed First Hello responses This feature plays a sound when live calls connect but can slightly delay audio transmission These adjustments will help you maximize call quality and minimize disruptions when using the Mojo dialing system. title: Why am I getting the error: Your current subscription has 1 dialing subscription
description: Mojo Dialer Licensing Requirements License Requirements Each agent who wants to use the dialer needs their own dialer license Multiple agents dialing simultaneously require multiple licenses (one per agent) Common Error: "Your Subscription has 1 ...
content: Why am I getting the error: Your current subscription has 1 dialing subscription Mojo Dialer Licensing Requirements License Requirements Each agent who wants to use the dialer needs their own dialer license Multiple agents dialing simultaneously require multiple licenses (one per agent) Common Error: "Your Subscription has 1 dialing subscription" This error typically appears when you're trying to use a license that's already in use. This can happen when: Another agent on your account is currently using the available license You're attempting to dial from two different browser tabs with the same agent account You recently used the Mojo on the Go Dialer app and didn't completely log out Troubleshooting Steps Check if anyone else on your account is currently using the dialer Close any duplicate browser tabs with Mojo open Ensure you're fully logged out of the Mojo on the Go Dialer app If you continue experiencing this issue after checking these common causes, please create a support ticket for our team to investigate further. title: Skip Tracer Tips
description: Maximizing Skip Tracer Results: Best Practices Skip Tracer won't return 100% results, but these tips will help you achieve the best possible performance: Address Formatting Requirements Ensure addresses have separate fields for: Street City State Zip ...
content: Skip Tracer Tips Maximizing Skip Tracer Results: Best PracticesSkip Tracer won't return 100% results, but these tips will help you achieve the best possible performance:Address Formatting Requirements Ensure addresses have separate fields for: Street City State Zip Code Avoid importing all address elements into a single field Data Types to Avoid P.O. Boxes: Not included in our dataset; always use street addresses Commercial properties: Low success rate Bank-owned properties: Low success rate Properties owned by: Trusts Investors Limited liability companies (LLCs) Estates Special Handling for Absentee Owners Map addresses correctly: Property address → Property Address field in Mojo Mailing address → Mailing Address field in Mojo When running Skip Tracer, select the option to look up the mailing address This ensures you're contacting the actual homeowner, not tenants Understanding Success Limitations Distressed properties may meet validation requirements but still lack owner information Our dataset updates daily with additions, deletions, and changes Owners of distressed properties often vacate and temporarily disappear from our database For questions about these tips or using Skip Tracer, please contact our support team. renderApp && renderApp();

title: No Expired Data in List After Purchase
description: Troubleshooting Missing Expired Data If you're not seeing your Mojo Expired Data after subscribing, check these common solutions: Where to Find Your Data Refresh your browser Look in the Properties Lists inside the Mojo Data/Dialer area Confirm ...
content: No Expired Data in List After Purchase Troubleshooting Missing Expired DataIf you're not seeing your Mojo Expired Data after subscribing, check these common solutions:Where to Find Your Data Refresh your browserLook in the Properties Lists inside the Mojo Data/Dialer area Confirm you're checking the correct location before troubleshooting further Common Issues Check the data delivery schedule Data pushes occur daily, typically around 7am in your local time, but can be later If you subscribed after the daily push (e.g., at 3pm), you won't see data until the following morning Verify your MLS selection Make sure you selected the correct MLS during setup Incorrect MLS selection means your chosen cities/zip codes won't align with available data Double-check your MLS settings if no data appears Confirm active subscription Your recurring payment may have failed Check your payment information and update if necessary to resume data delivery If you've checked all these issues and still don't see your data, contact Mojo support for additional assistance. content: Mojo is filtering data out before I begin calling Understanding and Managing Filtered Data Alerts in Mojo DialerWhen starting a dialing session, you may see alerts that Mojo is filtering out data. Here's what you need to know:Why Data Gets Filtered This is often intentional based on your chosen dialing filters Filters help you target specific contacts and comply with calling regulations How to Include Filtered Data When you see the filtered data alert, click "To view filtered data or clear filters" A grid will appear showing all applied filters and affected records Click the red "X" for specific filters you want to clear if available Special Cases That Require Different Actions When using EZ Calling Mode: "Call where I last left off" Restart your session Choose EZ Calling Mode: "Call from top to bottom" on the Call Wizard page When data is filtered by Zone Guard Exit your dialer session Navigate to Settings > Dialer Settings > Zone Guard Turn Zone Guard off or adjust to an appropriate time frame Important: Use caution when disabling Zone Guard as it protects you from calling outside your set limits These steps will help you manage your filtered data appropriately while maintaining calling compliance. title: Voicemail, caller ID and Whitelisting management
description: How to Configure Caller ID, Voicemail, and Whitelisting in Mojo Properly configured caller ID and voicemail settings help maximize contact rates and maintain professional communications. Here's how to set them up: Configuring Caller ID Click Settings ...
content: Voicemail, caller ID and Whitelisting management How to Configure Caller ID, Voicemail, and Whitelisting in Mojo Properly configured caller ID and voicemail settings help maximize contact rates and maintain professional communications. Here's how to set them up: Configuring Caller ID Click Settings in the bottom left corner Select Add Caller ID Enter: The phone number to display as your caller ID A label to identify this number within Mojo (not visible to contacts) Optional extension if applicable Choose whether to whitelist your caller ID (recommended) If not whitelisting, click Verify and follow the phone verification instructions Whitelisting Your Caller ID For New Numbers: Click Settings in the bottom left corner Select Add Caller ID and complete the required fields Check the box for whitelisting Enter your Caller ID/Registration Name (following the guidelines provided) Read and agree to the terms, then click Verify For Existing Numbers: Navigate to Settings Find the number you want to whitelist and click Submit Check the whitelisting box Enter your Caller ID/Registration Name Agree to terms and click Save Setting Up Drop Voicemail Access Settings from the bottom left corner Click Messages on the left menu, then select Drop Voicemail Click Add Drop Voicemail Choose your recording method: Mobile Phone: Scan the provided QR code to record Web: Grant microphone access to record via your computer Name your recording, create your message, and save These configurations will help optimize your outreach effectiveness and call connection rates. description: Multi-Line Dialing with Mojo Dialer How Multi-Line Dialing Works Mojo Dialer makes calls in rounds of 2 or 3 lines (based on your Call Wizard selection) All lines dial simultaneously, as shown in the dialing interface As calls conclude, the system ...
content: What happens when multi-line dialing and more than one line connects? Multi-Line Dialing with Mojo DialerHow Multi-Line Dialing Works Mojo Dialer makes calls in rounds of 2 or 3 lines (based on your Call Wizard selection) All lines dial simultaneously, as shown in the dialing interface As calls conclude, the system immediately replaces them with new calls This process continues until a live answer is detected When Someone Answers You'll immediately hear the person say "Hello" (if they speak) and can begin your conversation Other active lines continue dialing until they reach a conclusion Once all other calls finish, new dialing pauses until your live conversation ends Handling a Second Live Answer The system responds to a second live person answering in one of two ways: Option 1: Call Back Message Enabled If you've recorded and selected a Call Back Message in the Call Wizard: Your pre-recorded message plays for the second caller Call ends automatically after message completes System automatically redials this number after your current call ends (using single-line dialing) Option 2: No Call Back Message Enabled If no Call Back Message is configured: Second live call disconnects immediately System automatically redials this number after your current call ends (using single-line dialing) After Call-Back Attempts Once all call-back attempts complete, the system resumes multi-line dialing Answering Machine Handling If a second line detects an answering machine, no voicemail is left The call terminates immediately Related Articles What is the Latency Meter in Mojo? title: How Many Rings Should I Set the Dialer for?
description: Setting Ring Count for Prospecting with Mojo When prospecting with Mojo, you can customize how many rings occur before a call is marked as "No Answer." This feature runs automatically in the background, significantly improving your prospecting ...
content: How Many Rings Should I Set the Dialer for? Setting Ring Count for Prospecting with MojoWhen prospecting with Mojo, you can customize how many rings occur before a call is marked as "No Answer." This feature runs automatically in the background, significantly improving your prospecting efficiency.Ring Count Guidelines 4-5 rings: Ideal if your goal is to speak with live people and minimize answering machine/voicemail encounters 6-7 rings: Best choice if you want to maximize every call opportunity and are comfortable leaving messages on answering machines/voicemails Optimizing Your Contact RateIf you're using a 4-ring cycle and experiencing low contact rates: Increase to 5 rings when calling landlines Increase to at least 6 rings when calling mobile phones Important Note About Mobile CallsWhen calling mobile phones, the system counts rings on Mojo's side, not the recipient's side: The first 1-2 rings often occur while the cellular network locates the subscriber This means your 4-ring setting might only give the recipient 2 actual rings to answer This limitation applies to ALL mobile calls, regardless of whether you're using Mojo or another system Related Articles How to add/edit phone numbers and emails to a contact in MojoManaging Phone Numbers and Email Addresses in Mojo To add or update contact information: Navigate to your Data & Dialer screen Double-click on the contact you wish to modify When the contact form opens, look at the top middle section of the screen ... title: What is the Difference Between Lists and Groups
description: Understanding Mojo's Lead Management System: Lists vs. Groups Mojo's workflow is built around a clear distinction between calling lists and groups to efficiently manage your leads. Core Concepts Calling Lists: Contain new, uncontacted ...
content: What is the Difference Between Lists and Groups Understanding Mojo's Lead Management System: Lists vs. Groups Mojo's workflow is built around a clear distinction between calling lists and groups to efficiently manage your leads. Core Concepts Calling Lists: Contain new, uncontacted leads/properties/contacts Groups: Used for categorizing qualified contacts or those with existing relationships How the Workflow Functions New leads start in Calling Lists Once contact is made, move leads to appropriate Groups Default power dialing flow: Property Calling List → Groups (Hot Lead, Dead Lead, etc.) Calling Lists → Groups (Hot Lead, Dead Lead, etc.) Groups → Groups (Moving between existing groups) Real-World Applications Expired Listings Management New expired listings automatically populate your Properties calling list daily Call and qualify these leads Sort them into appropriate groups based on timing and interest Example: Leads planning to re-list in late summer go to "Late Summer" group Geographic Prospecting Create calling lists for specific neighborhoods (e.g., West Side) Call through the list and categorize based on urgency Leads moving in 90 days → "Warm Lead" group Leads moving in 30 days → "Hot Lead" group Sphere of Influence (SOI) Management Import SOI contacts into a specific group Keep SOI data separate from other lead data After contact, leads remain in the SOI group with updated notes Schedule regular quarterly calls to maintain relationships Customization No limits on group creation Create as many groups as needed based on: Urgency Timeframe Months Years Other categories Keep an eye out for upcoming explainer videos with additional tips in our tips videos section. title: File Import Errors
description: These errors are usually the result of file formatting problems, and can most often be resolved by re-saving the file to a different file type. The preferred file format for Mojo imports is a comma separated value (*.csv) or a Microsoft Excel (*.xls, ...
content: File Import Errors These errors are usually the result of file formatting problems, and can most often be resolved by re-saving the file to a different file type. The preferred file format for Mojo imports is a comma separated value (*.csv) or a Microsoft Excel (*.xls, *xlsx) file type. You may need to copy the data from the file, open a brand new file and paste the data then save and import the new file.If the file type is not the problem, check your file for the following:Each phone number must be contained within one cell (i.e., 5555555555 not the area code in one cell and the rest of the number in another cell)All phone numbers must be in the same format either 5555555555 or (555) 555-5555Address data must be contained in one cell (house number, direction, street name and possible unit number contained within one cell)File size for imports is limited to less than 5 MB (split the file if necessary)File data should be left-justified in the cellsSpecial characters in the data may cause problems (remove all special characters where possible)Remove any images or unsupported data typesIf you are still having problems with your import, please open a ticket with our Mojo support staff. title: What is the Latency Meter in Mojo?
description: Understanding Internet Quality Impact on Mojo Performance This guide helps you identify how internet connection quality affects your Mojo experience and what to expect under various conditions. Important Notes This guide covers common ...
content: What is the Latency Meter in Mojo? Understanding Internet Quality Impact on Mojo PerformanceThis guide helps you identify how internet connection quality affects your Mojo experience and what to expect under various conditions.Important Notes This guide covers common internet-related issues but may not address all potential problems within office networks The behaviors described below do not cover VoIP phone-specific issues (see VoIP section at the end) Key fact: If using a cell phone (with WIFI calling features turned off) or hardline phone, your call will NOT drop if you lose internet connection. Your internet only impacts data transmission in Mojo Quality MeterLocated at the bottom left of your Mojo interface, the quality meter provides real-time feedback (with less than 5-second latency) on your internet connection strength.While the meter considers connection speed, it primarily reflects signal quality measured by ping time in milliseconds: IIII (0-250ms) - Very solid connection No latency when navigating through Mojo or power dialing III (251-500ms) - Good connection Slight delay when navigating through contact records Power dialing performs normally with minimal impact II (501-750ms) - Poor connection Noticeable delays while navigating Mojo Contact-to-contact and data navigation becomes slow and jerky Reduced call volume capacity Dialing boxes may appear out of sync Lines may spend extra time in "free" and "preparing" states I (751-1000+ms) - Very poor connection Severe delays navigating through Mojo Extremely slow dialing Lines often stuck in "free" or "preparing" status Latency beyond 1500ms may begin dropping your signal to Mojo, triggering the "loss of internet" pop-up Connection Loss Pop-UpsMojo continuously monitors for complete internet connection loss while both navigating and dialing. When a loss is detected, you'll receive a notification pop-up. Note: These messages only appear when the connection issue is on the user's end. Technical support cannot troubleshoot internet-related issues, including network, firewall, router, VPN and anti-virus problems. Using VoIP Phones with MojoWhile thousands of users successfully connect to Mojo with VoIP solutions, be aware of these challenges: VoIP phones consume available bandwidth, reducing data transmission capacity Connection problems typically manifest first in your VoIP connection: Delayed "hello" connections Call drops Distorted "robot voice" audio Conversation issues like talking over each other Helpful tip: Request that your internet provider enable "voice priority" to prioritize voice connections over data during minor internet issues.Common VoIP Phone Services Skype Vonage Magic Jack SIP desktop phones Comcast Cable Business Phone System And many others If unsure whether you're using VoIP, check for an ethernet cord or phone line connection on your phone. You can also search for your phone's model number online. For additional questions, please contact our technical support team. title: How to Import Data Files in to Mojo
description: <br> Video Transcript: Here’s the text formatted with proper sentence structure and consistent flow, without changing any of the content: Hello and welcome to the first step of importing your spreadsheet. In this step, we're going to choose the ...
content: How to Import Data Files in to Mojo <br>Video Transcript: Here’s the text formatted with proper sentence structure and consistent flow, without changing any of the content: Hello and welcome to the first step of importing your spreadsheet. In this step, we're going to choose the file that you would like to import. First, I'll click Choose File, find the file that I'd like to import, and then click Open. Mojo accepts XLS, XLSX, and CSV files. Once I have my file selected, I can click Next to go to the next step. In Step Two of the import process, you'll choose where you want the spreadsheet to be imported. You can either import it into a calling list or a group. You can create a new calling list by clicking the plus sign on the top right corner and hitting Save. Or you can create a group. Groups are designated for leads that already have a qualification — they might be a hot lead, a warm lead, or a future follow-up. You might even create a group for your past clients or sphere of influence. You can also add to an existing list or group simply by clicking on the list or group that you'd like to add the spreadsheet to. You can also select a manager. The manager is optional — it's really only used if you have multiple agents under the account, and they are lower-accessed and you want them to have access to those leads that might be in specific groups. Otherwise, a manager is not needed. The source is where your data may have come from, and it's a good way for extra identification, but it is optional as well. You don't have to create one. You can either choose from some of your existing sources or create a new source. Once I have all my selections in step two, I'm going to click Next to move on to the next step. In Step Three of the import process, you'll be mapping your fields. Mapping your fields is simply matching up the fields from your spreadsheet to the spots that we have designated in Mojo. If you've imported a spreadsheet before or you would like to save what's called an import template, you would look over here on the left. An import template is just saving your mapping, so it will save you some time in the long run. Now, in Mojo, we do offer what's called Smart Mapping. If we recognize the fields that are on your spreadsheet, we will automatically match them up for you without you having to do anything extra. If you need a little extra help along the way, we do offer some instructional text here on the left. You'll see information for the import template and your spreadsheet reference — if we scroll all the way down to the bottom, we see a preview of your spreadsheet itself, so that way you're not just guessing what your spreadsheet looks like. We also discuss things like stacking fields and your miscellaneous fields. When you're mapping your fields, as mentioned before, you're just going to be matching up the fields from your spreadsheet to Mojo. You'll see Full Name automatically matched to the First or Full Name spot. If I have two separate names — a first name and a last name — then I would want to match the last name. If you have a co-owner, you would match the co-owner there. It looks like my Address already matched up, but my City did not. If I click the dropdown box, I can find Site City that matches with Property City. If I'm not sure, I can scroll down and take a look at the spreadsheet reference. If I find that there's a field out there that is matched that shouldn't be, I can click the X, and that will delete that mapped field. We have all the standard fields for Address, City, State, and Zip Code, including Mailing Address, Mailing City, and Mailing Zip. We automatically matched up three phone numbers here — Primary Phone, Phone 1, and Phone 3. If that wasn't all of the phones, I can match another one. I'll put Direct Phone there. When I added the phone number field, another phone number field showed up below that, so you'll be stacking your fields. If you have any phone fields on your spreadsheet that are specifically for Cell Phone or Mobile Phone, you would match them into the Mobile Phone field. Email goes to Email. Then we move down to the Miscellaneous Fields or Information Fields. These fields are for any additional pieces of information that might be on the spreadsheet outside of the basic contact information. If you're in real estate, you may have information like Listing Status or Status Change Date. If we don't have a field that's already created for you, we give you the ability to custom-create your own miscellaneous or information field just by clicking the plus sign. From here, you can name it and then choose the type — whether it's Text, Date, Time, Number, Decimal Number, or Percentage. I'll just choose Text for now. Now, if I had everything matched up that I wanted to and I knew I'd be importing from the same source over and over again, I would choose to save a template. Next time I come in, I would just have to click on the dropdown and choose my import template. Once I have everything matched up that I'd like, I'd click Next to go on to the next step. In Step Four of the import process, you will check for duplicates. Checking for duplicates is optional — you don't have to do that. We give you the option to check for duplicates against the entire database — meaning all lists and groups in your Mojo — or the file itself. The most common option for checking duplicates would be by the Phone Number, but we also give you the option to choose Email, Property Address, or Mailing Address. Then you’ll decide how you want to handle duplicates in the database: Keep Old – If the record already exists in your Mojo, we would not bring it in a second time. Keep New – This will overwrite and replace existing records in your Mojo with the new ones you're importing (which means you would lose any notes or call history). Import New and Old – This allows you to import duplicates so the same person can exist on multiple lists with different call histories and notes. As you change each option, the description will change so you can be reminded of what each option does. Once you've selected your duplicate options, you'll click Next to go on to Step Five. In Step Five — the final step of importing your spreadsheet — you can review everything that you've previously done. This includes: What list you're about to import into What source you’re using What fields you're about to import Duplicate information (how many duplicates were in the database and on the spreadsheet) If you want to go back and change any of your settings, you can click Back to return to the previous step. You can also fast-track back to the mapping step by clicking Remap Data. If you want to see the duplicates in your database, you can scroll down after clicking Show. The same applies to duplicates on the spreadsheet — you can view them directly. Once you've ensured everything is selected properly and all the fields you want to be imported are ready, click Finish Import. content: How To Set Up Action Plans <br>Video Transcription: Hello, In this video, I'm going to discuss action plans. I'm going to discuss what action plans are in Mojo, how to create them, and how to assign them to your leads. The first step would be getting into the settings section of your Mojo so you can create or access your existing action plans. To get to settings, you would click the menu on the bottom left, choose settings, and then from settings, you would choose action plans. An action plan is a preset follow-up sales process. What that means is instead of having to schedule a follow-up call manually every few days or remember to send an email every other day or to print off a letter every fifth day, you can set up an action plan that automatically schedules those types of follow-up actions. It's a one-click to assign, and everything gets scheduled out for you, helping ensure that no one's going to fall through the cracks. An action plan in Mojo can include follow-up calls, drip emails, printing of letters and labels, and tasks. You can create your own action plan or you can actually grab some pre-built ones that we offer in Mojo as well. When I choose pre-built action plans, you'll see we have a list of action plans. I've already imported some of them, so you'll see "already in use" for the ones I've grabbed. I can grab a new one if I want to and then choose to import it. Now I have the 8x8 action plan that was pre-built in Mojo. Anyone who has Mojo has access to these action plans. To create a brand new action plan, you would do so just by clicking the create button. Once you click on create, the first step is to enter a name. The next step would be choosing your scheduling type: frequency-based or date-based. Frequency-based means you're scheduling an activity based on specific days. For example, you may have a call that needs to take place on day one, then an email that goes out on day three, and a letter that goes out on day five. The date-based option is specific to the date on the calendar itself. For example, if you wanted the calls to happen on the 18th of the month or a letter to go out on the first of the month, that would be date-based scheduling. Next, you have to choose your scheduling logic. We have non-strict order and strict order. Non-strict order means that all of the activities that you have on your action plan will be available and scheduled throughout the entire course of the action plan. Strict order means that you have to complete the previous step before the next step is scheduled. On the bottom is the weekend option. In some cases, you don't want to have anything scheduled on weekends, whether it's an automated drip email or a phone call. If that's the case, you can choose whether you want your steps to be scheduled on the weekends. Now I'm going to go to the next step. In this step, we’re going to set up the different action plan steps. We start off on step one. From here, I can choose which type of action step I want. If I want an email, I would choose email. If I had multiple agents under the account and I wanted a specific agent to take care of this action plan step, I would choose that agent. Then I would choose the email template, which is one that I would have either created myself or pulled from one of the pre-built templates that we offer in Mojo. You can access the email templates or create your own by going to email on the left side in settings. Next, it asks me to choose which day I want to begin on. In this case, it says day zero. The way we have it set up, zero would mean today. If I assigned someone to the action plan today, this step would take place today on day zero. I can add additional steps. For example, I can add a phone call, choose a script for that call, and set it to take place on day three. I can add a mailing label and set it to take place on day six. I can add a task, which could be a simple reminder. I can also add a letter, choosing from either pre-built letters or ones I’ve created myself. I can add as many steps as I want and adjust the frequency as needed. Next, we have the trigger step. You can set it up so that your action plan is automatically assigned to leads based on a specific trigger. For example, if you wanted this plan to be assigned to expired properties, you would check off "property listing status," select "expired," and anyone with a listing status of expired in your properties list would automatically get assigned this action plan. You can also set triggers based on adding someone to a calling list or a group. Depending on how you want that trigger logic to work, you can choose to have the contact removed from the action plan if they are removed from that specific group, calling list, or listing status. In the video example today, I'm not going to choose any triggers, but we give you that option if you’d like. Click next to get to the last step, which is choosing your end logic. The end logic determines what happens when the action plan is finished. You could choose to do nothing, which means the action plan just finishes and that’s it. You could choose to repeat the action plan and schedule it to start again after a certain period. You could roll into another action plan and start a whole new process automatically. You can also choose to have all the records in the action plan, once they've reached the end, automatically assigned to a group of your choosing. Once you save the action plan, you’ll see it in the list of action plans. You can see the status, the type of scheduling, and the order type. You can click the edit button to change the details or view the list of contacts assigned to the action plan. If I select the expired property action plan, for example, I can see that I have five contacts currently in that plan. I can choose to edit the steps or delete the action plan if needed. If you want to assign an action plan to a record, you can do it from the data and dialer screen. Go to data and dialer, open a list (such as the Mojo Training List), select the records you want to assign, and choose "assign to action plan." You can choose the specific plan and set the start date. You can also assign action plans directly from the contact itself. If you open a contact record, you’ll see the action plan section at the top. From here, you can stop, change, reassign, or skip a step in the plan. You can even add an additional action plan if needed. Once an action plan is assigned, follow-ups will appear in the calendar section of Mojo. If you have any follow-up calls scheduled, they will show up in the future or the past if they were missed. You can also print out letters or labels directly from the calendar. This allows you to complete all of those activities efficiently. Instead of having to manually schedule follow-up calls, emails, and other steps, Mojo automates the process for you. This ensures that no one falls through the cracks and that your follow-up is consistent and strategic. That was an overview of action plans and how to create and use them in Mojo. If you have any questions or need more detailed guidance, reach out to our support team — we're always here to help. Thank you so much, and I hope you make it a great day! title: Mojo Prospecting Dashboard Overview
description: <br> Video Transcription: Hello, In this video, I'm going to show you all about the Personal Dashboard, or Prospecting Dashboard, that we offer in Mojo. This is a fantastic feature that allows you to keep track of your prospecting goals and ...
content: Mojo Prospecting Dashboard Overview <br>Video Transcription: Hello, In this video, I'm going to show you all about the Personal Dashboard, or Prospecting Dashboard, that we offer in Mojo. This is a fantastic feature that allows you to keep track of your prospecting goals and KPIs so you can be as efficient as possible when doing your prospecting. To access your Personal Dashboard, it's very easy. You go to the top right of your Mojo and you'll see an icon that looks like a phone with a little lightning bolt coming out of it. When you hover over it, it will say Personal Dashboard. When I click on that, it's going to take me to a whole new site. This site allows me to see a breakdown of all my different statistics and KPIs. If we look on the left, it keeps track of things like your dialing time, calls, contacts, leads, and the appointments that you set. We also get to see a graphic here showing progress toward your goal. You can set specific goals for yourself, and it breaks down your calls per hour, contacts per hour, calls per contact, contact rate, and prospecting time per lead. We do all of the math for you so you can really see where your time is going when doing your prospecting. Now, you're not going to start off with a goal right away—you'd have to set that. If I choose Edit, this is the screen that you would see when you're setting up your goal. You can choose your dialing time—how much dialing time you want for your goal to be. For example, maybe I want it to be 5 hours and 30 minutes or maybe 25 hours. You can choose which goal you want to see while you're making calls, and it’ll keep you up to date with how close you are to reaching your goal. You can set your goal for a week, a month, or even a custom date range if you'd like. Once you hit Submit, it takes you back to this screen where it's going to show you where you're at with your goal. Team Leaderboard Beyond the Personal Dashboard, we have some other features as well, such as the Team Leaderboard. If you have multiple logins or multiple agents under your account, you can have a leaderboard and be able to track all of this right from this section. If you're the owner or manager of an account, you can leave this up and track the progress and KPIs of all of the agents under your account. It will show you who is in the lead based on the top stats, including total contacts and calls. It breaks everything down very nicely and neatly. If I click on an individual agent, it will show me their individual statistics. Leagues We also offer Leagues. Leagues allow you to compare and compete against other members of Mojo outside of your account. You can start your own league and make it public so that anybody can join, or you can have it private, so it's invite-only. It's a great way to build a network of other Mojo subscribers who also want to make sure their prospecting time is used in the most efficient way possible. Total Revenue Tracking We've included a Total Revenue option as well. Within Total Revenue, you can see how much revenue you've generated, what your start date is versus your end date, and other key metrics. For example, if I select a later date range, it will show me how much total dialing time I've had, how many calls I've made, and how many appointments I've set. It does all the math for you, breaking everything down clearly. Historical Data We also include Historical Data. Historical Data lets you see how many calls you've made, how much dialing time you've logged, and your average calls and contacts over a longer period of time. You can see it all in a nice graph. For example, if I want to look at all of my agents, it will show all of them. Or if I want to just see my own data, I can filter it that way. It's definitely a very powerful tool. Manual Progress Now, not all prospecting happens within Mojo. There might be times when you take an inbound call from someone or just call somebody back. If you want to count that as a contact or include that time in your dialing stats, you can choose Add Progress. This allows you to manually add progress to your Prospecting Dashboard. This feature helps you stay efficient and aware of where you're making your money and spending your time. Display on Big Screens This feature isn’t limited to just the computer. We've had many accounts and teams put it on a big screen TV in their office so that the whole team can keep an eye on the leaderboard and see who’s leading in calls, contacts, and leads. Leads and Appointments Finally, let's discuss what counts as leads and appointments. Leads – Within Mojo, you can designate groups as lead groups, which means that as you add people to that group, it will count as a lead in your Mojo. Appointments – These are specifically for appointments that are scheduled on your Mojo calendar. Contacts – These are counted when you mark someone as a contact within Mojo. Again, you can always manually add progress if needed. This was a video about the Prospecting or Personal Dashboard within Mojo—a powerful tool included in your subscription. Take advantage of it as much as you possibly can. Related Articles How To Use The Mojo Calendar<br> Video Transcript: Hello everyone, in this video, I'm going to talk about the Mojo Calendar section. title: How To Create Email Templates
description: <br> Video Transcription: Hello, In this video, I'm going to show you how to set up an email template. The first step will be going to settings. To get to settings, click the menu button on the bottom left and then choose settings. From ...
content: How To Create Email Templates <br>Video Transcription: Hello, In this video, I'm going to show you how to set up an email template. The first step will be going to settings. To get to settings, click the menu button on the bottom left and then choose settings. From settings, select email, which will take you to the template section. From the template section, you can either choose a pre-built template or start a new template. I'm going to start a new template. From here, I can either start from scratch or use one of the pre-existing layouts, which I can then alter and put in my own information. I'm going to start with the "Start from Scratch" option. Once I choose "Start from Scratch," the first part I need to enter is the label. The label is for your own internal reference, so it's important to label it something that's easy to identify so you don't have to open each template to find out what the content is. For today, I'm going to call it "My Demo Template." The subject is what people will see when you send them the email. You can choose to add attachments if you want, and you can also include subject tags. Tags within Mojo will automatically populate information from that record into your email. For example, if you want to include the person's first name, last name, or address, you can include that information using tags. You can also choose to CC or BCC with the email template. We start you off with a text block that says, "I'm a new text block ready for your content." You can delete that and start typing your content. As soon as you start typing, a toolbar will appear. If you want to include a merge tag, you would type something like "Dear [First Name]" and then begin writing the body. You can use the toolbar to adjust the size and type of font, bold or italicize text, align content, and more. This works well for basic emails, but you may want to include additional structure. On the right side, there's a content section where you can add more elements to your email. For example, you can add an image by dragging the image block over to the template, dropping it into place, and browsing to upload an image. You can also include buttons, dividers, social media links, dynamic content (like your email signature), HTML blocks, video links, icons, and additional text. Under the "Rows" tab, you can adjust the layout of your email. If you accidentally place content in the wrong section, you can delete it by clicking the trash can icon. This allows you to customize the structure of your email to suit your needs. In the "Settings" tab, you can adjust details like the content area width, content area alignment, and background color. This is an advanced email template creator, so it may take a little bit of time to get used to, but it's very powerful and gives you a lot of options. One feature we offer is the ability to improve your text with AI. Instead of thinking of all the content yourself, you can have AI create it for you. For example, if I want to write an email about Thanksgiving, I can ask AI to generate the content. I can adjust the tone to make it more formal, add humor, or shorten the text. Once I’m happy with it, I hit the save button and it automatically inserts the text into my template. You may want to see how your email will look before sending it. You can choose "Send Test Email" to send a test version to yourself, or you can select "Preview." The preview option allows you to see how the email will look on both desktop and mobile devices, which is important since many people check their emails on their phones. We give you a lot of options for creating email templates, but the best advice we can give is to keep your emails simple. The more complex and cluttered your email is, the more likely it is to end up in a spam folder. Avoid using too many buzzwords and try to keep your messaging clear and straightforward. I'm going to save this template, and it will now show up in the settings section. This has been a video about creating an email template. Thanks so much, and I hope you're making it a great day! title: How To Use The Mojo Calendar
description: <br> Video Transcript: Hello everyone, in this video, I'm going to talk about the Mojo Calendar section. The Calendar section is where all of your activities, such as follow-up calls, tasks, appointments, printing out letters and labels, ...
content: How To Use The Mojo Calendar <br>Video Transcript: Hello everyone, in this video, I'm going to talk about the Mojo Calendar section. The Calendar section is where all of your activities, such as follow-up calls, tasks, appointments, printing out letters and labels, birthdays, and even home close date reminders, will show up. It's a very powerful tool that keeps you organized. As you can see here on the calendar, it shows all of my activities: appointments, tasks, follow-up calls, letters, labels, birthdays, home close dates, and I can even track my completed activities. I have the ability to look at just today, the past, or the future. These controls up here allow me to choose how I want to view my calendar. Right now, I'm in a list view, but if I clicked on that, it would show me more of a calendar view. All of my activities are displayed in the bottom section. You can choose to complete them or delete them by clicking the three dots on the far right. You can also quickly go to a different calendar date. We also have some mass actions you can perform. For example, you can select just your follow-up calls, mark them complete, assign them to a different person, print them, do a mass reschedule, or even export them. If you have follow-up calls that don’t have a specific time associated with them, you can easily dial them just by clicking the "Dial Follow-Up Calls" button. When you click that, it takes you to the Calendar Call Wizard, which allows you to start a dial session. You can do a power dial session or a click-to-call session on those follow-up calls. We can see all the different tasks broken down. Whether it was just a follow-up call or an appointment, it’s also where action plan activities will show up. Action plans are predefined sales pipeline processes, allowing you to assign someone to an action plan. It will automatically schedule follow-up calls or printing of mailing letters or labels. It's definitely a powerful tool and keeps you very organized right here in the calendar. We give you the ability to search for your contacts in here, and you can choose a specific date range if you're looking for them. This is again where you'll be able to see any follow-up call, task, or appointment that you have scheduled. If I open up one of the contacts, you’ll see the regular contact screen. To schedule an appointment, task, or follow-up call, simply click on one of the options at the top. If you have action plans, you'll be able to assign someone to the action plan. It will show you if they're already in an action plan, and again, it will schedule those activities on the calendar. This was just a quick video about how you can use the Mojo Calendar. Again, we have live training sessions twice a day at 11:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. Eastern, Monday through Friday. Our support team is always standing by to help you out. Thank you so much, and I hope you make it a great day! Related Articles How To Set Up Action Plans<br> Video Transcription: Hello, In this video, I'm going to discuss action plans. title: Navigating The Data and Dialer
description: <br> Video Transcript: Hello everyone, in this video, I'm going to talk about the Data and Dialer screen. The Data and Dialer screen is where you're going to spend most of your time when using Mojo. Aside from making calls, this is where you'll ...
content: Navigating The Data and Dialer <br>Video Transcript: Hello everyone, in this video, I'm going to talk about the Data and Dialer screen. The Data and Dialer screen is where you're going to spend most of your time when using Mojo. Aside from making calls, this is where you'll see all of your lists, organize your data, perform mass actions, and stay in touch with the data you have in your Mojo account. We break everything down into different categories: All Contacts: This shows you all of the contacts in your entire database. Properties: Here, you can choose whether you want to select an expired list, a cancelled list, or a withdrawn list. This is where any data with a listing status will go. For example, if you subscribe to Mojo’s expired data, you would see that data posted into the property section under the expired calling list. Calling Lists: This is where any of your data will go that you import as a spreadsheet, or if you have a vendor that posts data directly to your Mojo account as a calling list. If you're subscribed to the Neighborhood Search and bring in a list, it will also appear here. Groups: This is where all of your data will go once you've qualified it. For example, once you've spoken to someone and qualify them as a hot lead, warm lead, or maybe not a great lead, you can classify them under trash or not yet interested. When you select a list, it will turn green. This indicates that you’ve selected that list, group, or property list. The Data and Dialer screen is also where you'll be able to perform mass actions. Mass actions include selecting your records either individually, by selecting all, or by selecting a page. You can then choose the "move to" option to move the selected contacts to a group, a list, or your internal Mojo Do Not Call (DNC) list. You can also assign contacts by assigning a manager or action plan, or choose to export your data. We also have a Find Duplicates option. This feature allows you to easily find any duplicates in your Mojo account. You can either link them or choose to delete them. Additionally, you have the option to create a contact manually. You can also print labels, letters, or just print out the contacts themselves. If you need to change which fields to display on the screen, you can do so by choosing "Manage Columns." If you have an integration with a service like Constant Contact, there may be an integration button here that allows you to send data to that vendor from this screen. When managing your lists, you do have some other options. You can create a list rule, share or unshare a list (if you have lower access agents), edit the list name, or delete the list. We also have Calling Profiles. Calling profiles are used if you have lower access agents under your account who need a specific set of calling filters and settings. These agents would only be able to dial off of that calling profile. Some people also use calling profiles just to save their call settings, but it's mostly used for lower access agents. Finally, at the bottom of the screen, there’s the Import File button. The Data and Dialer screen is where you'll go to import your file if needed. This has been a video about the Data and Dialer screen. Remember, we offer live training sessions twice a day at 11:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. Eastern Time. If you need additional support, you can always call our support line. Thanks so much, and I hope you have a great day! title: How to Use List Rules
description: <br> Video Transcript: In this video, I’m going to show you how to use and make list rules. List rules in Mojo are a great way to help you manage and organize your data. They allow automation to do some of the heavy lifting for you, which will ...
content: How to Use List Rules <br>Video Transcript: In this video, I’m going to show you how to use and make list rules. List rules in Mojo are a great way to help you manage and organize your data. They allow automation to do some of the heavy lifting for you, which will definitely make things easier in the long run. This means less guesswork and fewer manual tasks. List rules can be set up to perform multiple different actions. These actions include moving contacts, scheduling calls, sending emails, and even deleting contacts. Creating a List Rule: The first step to creating a list rule is to click the three dots to the right of a list that you'd like to create the list rule for. Once I'm in the list rule creator, I can see if I have any list rules that I’ve already created. For example, I created one where the last call result equals "contact." If that's the case, I want it to be moved to a hot lead. That’s just one general rule, but you can create multiple list rules for different actions. Here are a few examples of what you can do: If call attempts equal 5, then I want it to move to a group and mark it as "Not Yet Interested." If a contact moves to a list, it can trigger an action plan, create a task, reset call attempts, send an email, or even delete the contact. Dynamic List Rules: Some people like to set up list rules that are more dynamic. For instance, if a contact reaches a certain status, it will automatically move from one list to another. For example, using the "Status Change Date" list rule, if a contact is older than 5 days, you can have it move to a 5-day-old expired list or a 5-day-old FSO list—whatever fits your needs. This feature gives you lots of options, and it can be very powerful in helping you manage your data. It takes the guesswork out of the process and keeps your database clean. This way, your leads will always move through your sales pipeline as you want, without you having to manually declutter or figure out what to do with leads on a list. Visual Indicators: Once I’ve created the list rule, you’ll see a little blue line to the left of any list that has a list rule applied. This indicates that there’s a rule on that list. You can then click the three dots again and choose "List Rule" to see the rule you’ve set up. I hope everyone out there gets a chance to take advantage of this great and powerful feature. It will make your time much more efficient and keep your sales pipeline flowing smoothly. Thanks so much for watching the video. title: How to Use the Neighborhood Search
description: <br> Video Transcript: Hello, in this video, I'm going to walk you through how to use the Neighborhood Search. The Neighborhood Search is one of Mojo's data products, and if you don't already have a subscription to it, you can navigate to the ...
content: How to Use the Neighborhood Search <br>Video Transcript: Hello, in this video, I'm going to walk you through how to use the Neighborhood Search. The Neighborhood Search is one of Mojo's data products, and if you don't already have a subscription to it, you can navigate to the lead store at any time to subscribe. I've navigated to the Neighborhood Search, which you can access by clicking the link I just showed you on the homepage. However, you can also access it from the data and dialer screen. There will be a blue button that says "Neighborhood Search." When I first come to the Neighborhood Search, it asks me if I want to grant permission to allow it to know my location. This is usually recommended, as it will zero in on the map to where your location is and make things a little bit easier for plotting the areas that you want. The Neighborhood Search is a very powerful tool that allows you to bring in data from just listed, just sold listings, for geo farming, just calling around high-valued neighborhoods, and we give you lots of tools to help you along the way. The first step that I would do once I come to the Neighborhood Search is to put in an address that I would want to search around. I’ll just do one locally around here. Once I've done that, I have the ability to choose how I want to search my area. So, I’ll have free-form plotting, radius, and you can get more specific with an individual street if you want to. I’ll start with the free-form plotting. As you can see, I can just place the plots on the map and then drag to contour to be more specific to the area that I'm looking for. You can zoom out on the map if you want to, to really get this specific area that you want. We give you the option over here to then choose radius plotting if you want to. I’ll show you the radius plotting now. Once I choose that, it gives me a circle. I can stretch the circle out by grabbing the small circles on the outside. I can also move the circle over by clicking on the center circle and dragging it wherever I need it to go. We keep track of the radius that you're doing when you are doing the radius plotting. We have a map option section here that will give you a little legend, so if you see any of these icons, you’ll know what they mean. You can delete your past mappings or manage them if needed. We also give you an assortment of different filters that you can work with. You can choose to include properties with no phones. Some people like to do mailers, and that's a good way to get a lot of mailers. You can also choose to select by property type. We’ve recently included land as an option as well. You can specify multi-units and the number of units. If you only want absentee owners, free and clear properties, and other filters, we’ve got you covered, including AVM, loan to value, square footage, bedrooms, and bathrooms. Once you have the area that you want, you’ll see the total contacts searched and the contacts matching the filters. By default, we do not allow the Do Not Call list. This will show you the total amount that was going to be imported. Once I have the area that I want, I then click "Import." It just gives me an alert about what status I chose for my DNC scrubbing. I choose to understand, and here is where I would give it a list name. It lets me know if any of these contacts already exist in Mojo, and then I finish my import. It just told me that the 56 contacts were successfully imported. Now, I can go to my data to see my list, or I can go back to the map and do another search. This has been a walkthrough of the Mojo Neighborhood Search. Remember, we do have live trainings twice a day at 11:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday, and our support team is always standing by to help you out. Thank you so much, and I hope you make it a great day!
