title: How To Create A Sublist
description: <br> Video Transcript: Hello! In this video, I'm going to walk you through how to make a sublist with Mojo. A sublist is a great tool to filter out an existing list and specify the pieces of information you want to focus on. You can create a ...
content: How To Create A Sublist <br>Video Transcript: Hello! In this video, I'm going to walk you through how to make a sublist with Mojo. A sublist is a great tool to filter out an existing list and specify the pieces of information you want to focus on. You can create a sublist from any field that you have access to in Mojo. For example, here we have fields like "Full Name," "Property Address," and "Property City." You can see additional fields when you scroll to the right on my screen. You can also add other available fields by choosing the "Manage Columns" option on the top right. Creating a Sublist: The first step to creating a sublist is to click on your list. For today’s example, I’m going to choose my "Mojo Import Video One" list. If you were to choose your properties list, you’d start there and filter by the different columns. But for today, I’ll use the Mojo Import Video list. In the past, when we had our sublist creator, it would take you to a completely different screen. But now, we’ve simplified the process. All you have to do is click on the list, and you’ll see the different columns with icons next to them. When you hover over these icons, they say "Filter," so you know they’re the filter icons. Filtering the List: For this example, I’m going to click the filter icon and filter by the status of "Expired." Now, I only see the expired contacts. If I want to save this filtered list as a sublist, I would click "Save Sublist" and name it. Now, you’ll see the sublist shows up right below the original list. Understanding Sublists: When you create a sublist, it doesn’t take the data out of the original list. It’s just a more specific version of that list. From here, you can start a dial session, print based on the specifics in that list, and manage your data more efficiently. It’s a very easy and powerful tool. Editing a Sublist: Maybe you want to edit this existing sublist. If you look, I’m selected on that sublist now, and I can add another filter. For instance, I want to filter by a date range, so I’ll select the ones from the 25th to the 25th and apply my filters. Now, I have a sublist with only those contacts from the 25th. If I want to save this, I can click "Save Sublist." I’ll have the option to either save over the existing sublist or save it as a new sublist. I’m going to save it as "Expired 11/25." Now, I have two sublists. Key Notes: Remember, the sublists are still part of the original list. They’re just more specific versions of it. You can create sublists based on multiple filters and values, which really helps when you need to focus on specific parts of your list. If you have a very large list and only want to focus on certain cities or dates, this feature is perfect for that. Essentially, you can filter and create sublists based on whatever you need with these columns. Thank you so much for watching this video about making a sublist. Remember, we have live trainings at 11:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. Eastern, Monday through Friday. We also have live support standing by, ready to help you out. Thank you again, and I hope you make it a great day! content: How to subscribe to Mojo data services Subscribing to and Managing Data Services in MojoSells Subscribing to Data Services Access data services by logging into Mojo and clicking Leadstore in the top-left corner Navigate to Data & Dialer > Data Services from the dropdown menu Choose from available data service types: Neighborhood search Expireds For Sale by Owner (FSBO) Pre-Foreclosures For Rent by Owner (FRBO) Skip Tracing Click "Subscribe" and complete the setup process and payment information Your subscription activates immediately and will automatically renew based on your selected term (1, 3, 6, or 12 months) Managing Your Subscriptions View active subscriptions by navigating to the Leadstore section Locate your current data subscriptions displayed in the list Click the "Manage Subscription" button to access management options Click the 3-dot icon under the edit column to reveal available actions: Unsubscribe from specific data services (note: Mojo does not provide refunds for early cancellations) Edit subscription settings Extend subscription by selecting a longer term Delete subscription settings Regular management of your data subscriptions ensures you're only paying for the services that align with your current business needs. title: Mojo Expired Data
description: Mojo Expired Data: Premium Off-Market Leads What is Mojo Expired Data? Mojo Expired Data gives you access to premium off-market property leads, including Expired, Cancelled, and Withdrawn listings, delivered directly to your Mojo Dialer. This service ...
content: Mojo Expired Data Mojo Expired Data: Premium Off-Market Leads What is Mojo Expired Data? Mojo Expired Data gives you access to premium off-market property leads, including Expired, Cancelled, and Withdrawn listings, delivered directly to your Mojo Dialer. This service keeps you ahead of competitors with daily updates on listing status changes, empowering you to maximize productivity and close more deals. How Does It Work? Define your target area Select up to a 50-mile radius (as the crow flies) within your MLS area Choose specific cities/zip codes you want to target Get immediate historical data Upon initial purchase, receive up to 12 months of current Expired and Off-Market data (if available) Receive automatic daily updates New Expired and Off-Market data posts directly to your Mojo account each morning Find this data in the Properties list in the Data and Dialer section Leads are automatically sorted into specific lists based on listing status Benefit from status change tracking Your existing data is continually updated when listing statuses change For example, if a property changes from Expired to Active, it automatically moves to an Active list Affordable pricing Service costs $50 per month per MLS How to Add Mojo Expired Data Access the service Navigate to Leadstore by clicking Leadstore on the left of the screen Select Subscribe next to Expired Data Configure your area Choose your State Select your MLS (If your MLS isn't listed, click the button next to the blue Buy Now button) Enter a Zip Code to serve as the center point of your radius Select up to a 50-mile radius (a map and list of cities/Zip Codes will display) Choose the specific cities/zip codes you want to include Complete your purchase Click the Buy Now button and proceed with payment If historical data is available for your area (within the last 12 months), it will be automatically posted within 15 minutes (you may need to refresh your browser) This service helps you efficiently target motivated sellers with properties that have recently left the market. title: Skip Tracer
description: Skip Tracer: Complete Your Contact Data Skip Tracer is Mojo's powerful data enrichment service that fills in missing information in your contact records, including names, home phones, cell phones, email addresses, and property tax details from Mojo's ...
content: Skip Tracer Skip Tracer: Complete Your Contact DataSkip Tracer is Mojo's powerful data enrichment service that fills in missing information in your contact records, including names, home phones, cell phones, email addresses, and property tax details from Mojo's data sources.Benefits Complete partial contact records with accurate information Find owners of properties when you only have addresses Access valuable property tax information Save time searching for contact details manually Purchasing Skip Tracer Access the service Log in with a Mojo owner's account Click the Leadstore button Click the Subscribe button Complete your purchase Select your desired subscription length (number of months) Click the Buy Now button Confirm your purchase on the dialog that appears Using Skip TracerFor Individual Contacts Navigate to Data & Dialer Double-click the contact you want to complete Click the Skip Tracer button on the Contact Details screen Choose whether to scrub against the Federal Do Not Call list Available information will automatically populate in the contact record For Batch Processing Go to Data & Dialer Select the list or group you want to process Click the Skip Tracer button (located below the Power Dialer button) Choose between: One Time Lookup: Enter property address information, select DNC preferences, and click Lookup Batch Lookup: System validates your data for incomplete addresses, then: Review the number of properties eligible for Skip Tracing Select additional skipping options Choose DNC list preferences and whether to ignore previously searched records Click Continue to process your list Results After processing completes, you'll see a summary of found information Updated contacts will include a note describing what was found Contacts with new information will have a Property tab containing tax details This service helps ensure your database contains the most complete and accurate information possible for your prospecting efforts.
